Reviews.Title: “Amazing intro to the city”
Reviews.Author: OnVacationSoon
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam on an early morning flight, much too early to check into the hotel. When we arrived before 9am, we requested a place to house our bags until check-in. We were extremely pleased to find that, with just a brief wait, a room would be readied for us! We parked our bags in a spacious, updated, clean room with excellent lighting and places to store our 2-week supply of clothing and shoes. The bathroom was huge, by European standards... and even by spoiled American standards! The tub was full sized and deep! Towels were plush and oversized. Bed was big and comfy... with blankets warm enough to fight off the the chilly October damp and cold. Far exceeded our expectations on every level! A good hike to museums, even further to the city center but trolly service was close by and frequent.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful haven in a beautiful neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Ulster_Exile
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights here over Easter 2012 and very much enjoyed our visit. The location for us was pefect - a quiet street in an upmarket suburb but only 2 minutes walk to a tram stop and from there 15-20 mins into the city. It was great to arrive back after a busy day sightseeing in the centre of A'dam, Our room was quiet, comfortable and well furnished, bathroom clean and well equipped and good tv and clock radio. All staff were charming, friendly and helpful when approached. We didn't eat breakfast as it wasn't included in our rate and at â‚¬17 per person was not within our budget - the restaurant did however look very nice. If you stay at the Bilderberg I recommend catching the 24 tram across to De Pijp where there is an excellent choice of bars and restaurants. Also, 5 minutes walk towards the city is Wildschutt - a cafe bar which did great food and had a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Bilderberg: not cheap but a good value!”
Reviews.Author: emoshea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights after a week in an apartment in Paris and enjoyed the excellent service here! We had a room on the executive level which was quite nice. The Internet is pricey here, and they have different rates for smartphones and computers. Seems like for the executive rate they could comp the Internet. Tram is a quick walk. Watch out for taxis - when they hear the Bilderberg is your destination they may jack up the rate or lengthen the ride.

Reviews.Title: “uitstekend”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCrown
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a lovely part of Amsterdam... Go wild elsewhere and come back to this quiet place. If you're at the RAI, this is only 5 mins taxi and 10Euros. Excellent staff, in particular the concierge. Lovely breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @ this nice and quiet hotel in the south of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Freek_sander
Reviews.Content: Try the restaurant; surprisingly good food it's charming and the daily menu's are great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Really great stay.”
Reviews.Author: kevin b
Reviews.Content: The Bilderberg is very upscale, with people arriving in exotic cars, and wearing expensive suits. The beds were very comfortable and we had no trouble sleeping. We took advantage of a flash deal, and paid an outrageously low price for the room. I would positively stay there again if I was in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Home”
Reviews.Author: J_Augusto_Oliveira
Reviews.Content: It was wonderfull, the staff were so friendly, everything was better than the i spected. The room was cleaned with a good attention, the service of all areas was perfect. The check out was fast and correct. The hotel is in a nice area, and very easy to go in all direction. The price was excellent due to it was a great promotion for the low period.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicka V
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff and the dinner in the Kersentuin was great! Excellent food. T

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself to that little extra luxury”
Reviews.Author: pg003
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with very pleasant and accommodating staff. Very clean and spacious rooms. The hotel is very well kept and a very pleasurable experience. The restaurant is a pleasurable dining experience. The food is extremely pleasant and gives you a mouth explosion of taste, however; the main portions a little on the small side but as a fine dining experience it is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Jens-Peter V
Reviews.Content: The staff at Bilderberg Garden were not very serviceminded. We were misplaced in a wrong room, and were just told to pack our suitcases and go to the reception. I would have expected them to offer to move for us. We stayed in an executive room, which are located in a special wing. The executive room was bigger than normal rooms and have a spa. The ceiling had big brown stains from water damages and a cracked plate - not OK for a room near â‚¬180 per night. Internet costs a â‚¬17/24h for unrestricted access which is far too expensive. Restaurant is very cold when sitting close to the windows. It is unacceptable that they don't install heaters between the windows and the tables. We asked to be moved away from the corner table in order to have a windows on only one side, and I had to wear my jacket in order not to freeze. We spend a total of 2Â½ hours for a 3 course meal in a restaurant only half full. Steak ordered medium-rare was served well-done, but was replaced within minutes (another customer had to wait for his dinner then). Dinner was overall good. Breakfast was not impressive, but had a reasonalble variety of choices to pick from. Staff in reception was both arrogant and rude when I had to rush them for a taxi they clearly had forgotten to order. Initially they claimed that time was only one minutes past, when it really was almost 5 minutes later "The computer says so". I allmost was late for business meeting. Only one of 3 receptionists was allowed to call for taxis (Just imagine - they have a "Taxi manager"). I have no intensions of using the hotel again - mainly because of the poor service. I could have accepted all the minor mistakes - they happens, but not with this level of service. Before visiting Amsterdam, I was twice in UK and stayed both times at Hilton hotels. Servicelevel was impressive, and staff was very kind, polite and paying much more attention to their guests. Just imaging that it can make such a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “Cheated”
Reviews.Author: Mark K
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expediaâ€™s â€˜Mystery Hotelâ€™ scam. I was offered a deep discount for a 5* hotel in the museum quarter. This is what they produced, a hotel in Amsterdam Rai at a Â£5 discount to their next best rate. This may be technically 5* based on the facilities it offers but in terms of aesthetics itâ€™s a 3* hotel at best, particularly the entry level rooms have not been re-furbished. I would recommend the area but the nearby Hilton would be a better choice for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected a 5 star hotel to be ... disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Cat1194
Reviews.Content: On arrival everything went smoothly, the staff were friendly and helpful. Orignally we had book and standard room but were offered the choice to upgrade and took it. The extras included a "Jacuzzi bath," which sounds lovely but was very disappointing. It was a small bath that only produced cool bubbles. This meant that my lovely warm bath was cold within 5 minutes. There were only weak jets, some of which had their caps missing. This was a disappointment. The room was nice but none of the features said 5 star. The mini bar was heavily overpriced. The location is also quite far out of town. I can however say the bed was very comfortable and the check out time of 12pm made for a lovely easy start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from centre!”
Reviews.Author: Javarney
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with good beds, nice staff and big rooms. All clean. It is not a 5* hotel so don't expect this. It is a 4* definately. The decor is dated and needs revamped. Mini bar very expensive. Overall good hotel but way too far out and takes too long to the centre by tram and taxi .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: GJZ123
Reviews.Content: In the week before Christmas Iâ€™ve spent a night with my mother in law in this wonderful hotel. It is located in a nice and residential area of Amsterdam. The beds are wonderful, great staff at the reception and restaurant. The dinner was awesome! We had chosen for the menu of the month, this was a good value for money, absolute! I will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Halloween in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Dub38
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Halloween weekend in Amsterdam. They allowed us to check in early at 10am which was great as we were tired after out early flight. Room was fine, but maybe I expected more from a 5-star hotel with 5-star prices!! Didn't try the breakfast as it was really expensive (around 23 euro!!). Hotel is well located near the Vondelmark and the upmarket shops, away from the bustle of downtown Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: caviargal
Reviews.Content: We won this hotel on Priceline and were very pleased overall. We loved the location and much preferred it to being in the over touristed center. Staff was great. Room was very nice with great beds and well done bathrooms. I would give this a higher rating if there were a health club and if they were to replace the carpets as they were quite worn. It deserves a 4.5 but TA does not give me that option. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelrClayton
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in better 3 star hotels. However the staff were very friendly and helpful A tram stop is only 5 minutes away so very easy to get into the city Would stay here again but only if I can get a bargain price

Reviews.Title: “Close but no cigar”
Reviews.Author: Robert296
Reviews.Content: Stayed across New Year, and was disappointed to find that the restaurant was closed in the evenings. Although as others have pointed out the tram stop is very near, the trams stopped running at 8pm on New Years eve, so we had to dine early in a local steak house as they seemed to be the only place open and they were closing early. The room mini bar prices are staggering, all in all it is an expensive hotel and in my opinion is only average. The one thing in its favour is the staff, they are very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot - great location!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoK2
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Bilderberg Garden Hotel for my quick visit to Amsterdam. I visited just for an afternoon and evening, but everything was great. Upon arrival, I thankfully noted that I had pre-booked parking as there are only a few spots. They took the car and nicely parked it under a little carpark area and brought in my luggage. The room could have been a bit larger, but overall, it was quite nice and clean. The reception staff were so very nice, and helped me out with some things to do in my really short time there. I walked all over town and figured out the tram as well! I ate in the bar, which was delicicous. Had I had more time, I would have tried the restaurant, which looked amazing. However, my food in the bar was not only delicious, but also beautifully presented and simply amazing. Everyone there was very helpful and I really enjoyed myself. I would definitely stay again. Also, this part of town was simply perfect! You can get anywhere, but you are away from the hustle and bustle of the main square and all of that silliness.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: damsqu
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for an opportunity to stay at this hotel for a long time now and finally found the opportunity to stayâ€¦ Firstly, its about a 20 min easy tram ride away from central station (Tram 5 or 24), or I paid 20 Euros in a cab. You can use the trams (every few minuets) to take you in to the heart of things in about 10 minsâ€¦ On first impressions the side exterior of the hotel looked very warn and slightly depressing, reminding my friend and I of a council estate back home in the UK! The front of the hotel fares a lot better, but it is the side/back view you are first faced with when approaching the hotel. Inside the lobby and bar area it was a different story. Lovely warm feel with friendly staff. There was no queue for check in and it was all very smooth. Picked up a couple of drinks from the bar and headed up to the room. I booked an executive room, with late check out for 179euros on a Saturday night, direct through the hotels website. The executive room was disappointingly small and very worn around the edges, although overall it did seem very cosy, if a little hot. The twin beds were comfy and facilitated a really sound nights sleep. Good selection of coffee and a couple of teas but as another review pointed out one of the slowest kettles in the universe! I wasnâ€™t disturbed once during the night despite it being Amsterdam and a Saturday. The Jacuzzi bath was great fun, although it hadnâ€™t been cleaned properly, which I was astounded by from a 5 star hotelâ€¦ I skipped breakfast so canâ€™t comment on it. The late check out I paid for (20 Euros) was described on the hotels website as being able to check out at 6pm on a Sunday. I was told at the desk I would have to vacate at 5pm. All in all, this did not feel like a 5 star hotel and in the end I was disappointed with the price I paid, for what I got. It obviously needs a good facelift and refurbishment. Thank goodness for the friendly and helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “In need of a revamp it it wants to be regarded as a 5* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elscodobermann
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel every year for the past 5 years - it has an excellent location close to the RAI, and is far enough away from the busy centre of Amsterdam. However this year i must admit to being a bit disappointed. Firstly, the plus points. Location is great, entrance/bar etc are lovely, and all of the staff are extremely helpful and pleasant. The rooms again are always excellent, spacious, and very clean. The beds are also really good and comfortable. However, I did think this year that it looks as if it could do with a bit of an update. The furnishings etc (especially carpets and wallpaper in the corridors) are beginning to look a bit jaded and worn. Now - the food. We have eaten on a few occasions in the restaurant - but found that the menu barely changed from year to year. Yes it was good, but very expensive and not a great deal of choice. The breakfast however is a complete rip-off. Twenty two euros per person, and honestly very poor for half of that. We have tried it in the past and been not too keen, but as we were on a tight timescale our first day i chose to try the hot buffet - which was anything but hot. Sausage, scrambled eggs, bacon, mushrooms - all were cold (not just lukewarm, actually cold). We were in a hurry to get to an exhibition in the RAI that morning so really didnt have time to start complaining etc - we ended up just choosing from the continental buffet selection - which again is WAY overpriced for whats available. A very average selection of breads/meats and cheeses - not bad but nothing to write home about, and certainly not worth the price of a decent steak! If 2* hotels are able to keep hot breakfast options hot, then there is no reason why a hotel charging twenty two euros cannot. We chose to have breakfast in a variety of places over the rest of our stay - all far better in terms of quality and selection, and all for less than half the price. I think next year we will be finding somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay in many regards”
Reviews.Author: Henry H
Reviews.Content: First of all, even relative to europe, this is a 4 star, not 5 star at all imo. They really try to nickel and dime you for every small detail that they can. This was a priceline miss for me and it was not worth even the discounted rate I paid. The business(high speed) internet was extra and I needed faster and it is still much slower than what I would consider average rates and it has been frustrating to work. Location wise it is very inconvenient if you want to explore amsterdam or you are visiting. It is a clean area and the hotel facilities are clean and the staff is nice enough as well, but just given that I was expecting a 5 star hotel and wanted to explore amsterdam and was told it is convenient to get to the center and then being nickel and dimed for all small charges. I would not stay here again and would not use priceline to avoid it next time

Reviews.Title: “A place to rest from the pace of the City”
Reviews.Author: mooks070
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of our Honeymoon trip. The hotel is located in a leafy residential sector of the city about 2.5 miles south of Amsterdam central train station. There is a tram stop just 5 mins walk from the hotel. The entrance boasts a well planed marble themed reception area. The staff were very well presented and friendly. Realising we were not there on business (the impression this is that type of hotel) they were keen to show us a map of the city and give us tips on getting around the City. We stayed in the exec suite which felt very homely. It was spacious well laid out, very clean. All the suite furniture, bed, bathroom facilities and soft furnishings were of high quality. The room felt secure and very comfortable and was very quite, couldnâ€™t hear a thing. We didnâ€™t try the hotel food/bar or facilities as we were out most of the time enjoying the City but it was a pleasure to come back to this hotel in the evening....... or early hours..........Amsterdam eh?? If we ever come back to Amsterdam we will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: Refreshingly quiet location yet close to a gorgeous canal and an enticing pocket of upmarket shops, restaurants and cafe's. Staff were very friendly, helpful and professional. We accepted an upgrade to an Executive Suite for a reasonable price and thoroughly enjoyed our last night in Europe ahead of a long journey back to Australia. The jacuzzi bath was heavenly. The hotel restaurant was immaculate and very tempting but the warm evening enticed us out to enjoy an authentic Italian meal in a romantic outdoor setting. The Bilderberg is highly recommended if you prefer a little distance from the bustling, eccentric city centre atmosphere which is only a short tram ride away.

Reviews.Title: “A real home from home”
Reviews.Author: Love_Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: Comfortable business hotel, excellent value and amenities. Staff are very helpful. Great location. Fabulous service. I stay here on business trips, as the location is brilliant and it's very quiet. Also has a great restaurant onsite. Rooms are very big, comfortable, and lovely bathrooms. Breakfast is out of this world, worth getting out of bed early for ! It's also quite close to main shopping areas so would be good for a holiday as well as business trip.

Reviews.Title: “great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: ririnuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet residential area of Amsterdam, very close to the tram station (5 min walk) and close to a main shopping area (10 min). They managed to check us in at 8 o'clock in the morning and the staff was generally very nice to us. We could purchase tickets for 2 of Amsterdamâ€™s main museums from the hotel reception (Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum) and thus avoid a huge queue at the entrance. Also, we could arrange for the shuttle bus to come and take us to the airport, but I would not recommend it , because it was almost an hour late (although it was ok from the airport to the hotel). The room was spacious and clean, as well as the bathroom, but as with all hotels, there are the thin walls to be considered.The bed was very comfortable and they came and change the sheets daily. The hotel restaurant is called 'De Kersentuin' and it's a very good one - I recommend it. Overall, it was a nice stay and I would definitely go back to stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet with great acces to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Dee Z
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of our trip to Europe we stayed two nights at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel. We arrived early and were delighted to find our rooms were ready. Upon arrival we spent some time reception area and had some of the best coffee ever. We found our rooms spacious and just as described. The front desk was very helpful and were always happy to answer any questions and help us with reservations and information on how to use the tram. Access to the tram was just a short walk away and getting around Amsterdam using the tram was very easy. Overall we had great accommodations great service and a great time!! Highly recommended. The only draw back may be that the hotel is in a out of the way very quite area. Not a problem for us. We just hopped the tram and were in the thick of things in no time. Watch out for the bikes, scooters, trams and cars.....pedestrians seem to be at a disadvantage in Amsterdam. We had fabulous time!!! Would love to go back and explore some more.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: sb5000
Reviews.Content: I just came from spending three nights at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel. I really can't complain as it is a great hotel. It's quiet and the rooms are great. The room service was fantastic. They use Swisscom for their internet and it's always a bit expensive for what you get. It's not right in the center of town but hotels in the center are generally very noisy. There are nearby restaurants so it's really not a problem. I would certainly return to this hotel as it was really a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't come back”
Reviews.Author: Sum1_from_London
Reviews.Content: When I booked this place it said it was centrally located and a five star hotel. Both not true. This hotel is located in a nice, seemingly very safe residential neighbourhood, but the hotel was a letdown. In terms of location it's definitely not as centrally located as I would have liked. I was only here for two nights, so it wasn't so bad, but if I had been here for longer the location would have disapponted me. It's a short 15-20 minute tram ride into the centre of town, but it's within walking distance of nowhere. There are not really any nearby restaurants, and nothing to do that's within a walk. I got the impression it was far more central, but this really is out there in the sticks. I would definitely have paid a bit extra for someone with more hustle and bustle if I'd known this hotel was so far away from everything. The hotel staff were nice enough, no problems, and helpful with directions. Amsterdam seems like a great place, only I think I would have soaked up far more of the atmosphere and had a much better time if I'd stayed somewhere more centrally located. The room itself was a real disappointment. It was no way five star. I have stayed in three stars that are better than this. It was small, the windows weren't that clean, and I couldn't even open the windows because they were locked. The view was nothing to speak of. Although there was a really irritating piece of metalwork right outside my hotel room. You see, there was a little park area outside, and they had this metal contraption there that was meant to be an art work. Every hour, on the hour, it would creak and ring it's bell for about ten minutes. Often waking me, and even in the morning this was simply annoying. The shower was a dissapointment too. Yes the water was hot, but the shower screen was loose, so after I left my shower to run for a bit so the water would get warm, I realised the whole bathroom was flooded because the shower screen had gaps where it had been attached. Luckily I was only there for two days, so didn't have to put up with a flooded bathroom for long. Even the kettle didn't work properly. I think it's the longest time I have ever waited for a kettle to boil - it took about 15 mins. All in all, this place was not what I wanted, I would have paid a bit extra for better, as I think I would have enjoyed Amsterdam far more. And just for the record, I'm not usually a complainer. I have stayed at many hotels and not really had a bad word to say about any of them. But...here...it wasn't the very worst hotel you could get...but it was certainly enough to put a dampener on my stay in Amsterdam. I think if you really want to see the city, then don't stay here. Really, it's worth paying a bit extra for somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little away from restaurants and with pricey, slow Internet”
Reviews.Author: Zoomed
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great but located in a quiet neighborhood. Staff were helpful and friendly.You will need to walk a few blocks to find restaurants etc. When are quality hotels going to stop charging exorbitant rates for bad internet? Just include Internet in the room charge please! And don't make me give up all my personal info just to get on-line!! FYI laundry service is very expensive. Eg 2â‚¬ for 1 handkerchief. Found a nice wasserete on Banstraat. 8â‚¬ for 5 kilos.

Reviews.Title: “inflexible terrible”
Reviews.Author: thejoth
Reviews.Content: do not book this hotel through expedia. no changes are possible. they will keep your money and laugh at you. terrible rude staff with no understanding of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “I would rate this hotel a 4 star, and not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sushi33
Reviews.Content: Positive points: Hotel is located in very quiet area. Convenient location near Mseemplace (15 minutes walk or 2 stops with tram). Taxi to hotel from Dam square cost 12 Euros Suggested walk to Museumplace, through 'Cornely Schuystraat' with many trendy fashion shops and nice cafÃ©s and restaurants, and then you can reach in 20 minutes, Rijksmuseum and VanGogh museum. Buy tickets in advance from reception desk so to to avoid long waiting queues. Negative points: 1- There is no separate Reception and Concierge desk, and during day, only 2 persons and at evening only 1 person are available. So it is necessary to wait every time, you need information about Amsterdam and/or about your room. 2- Internet works very poorly, even if you choose Business connecting service provided by Swisscom (WIFI hotel provider). In addition, necessarry to register twice separetely, (2x the cost) for a pc and a Iphone or Blackberry, which is not correct.

Reviews.Title: “For people with more money than sense.... Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: withnail69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bilderberg Garden hotel from the 5th-7th August. We had booked a double room for two nights. Upon arrival I was shown to a twin room. I explained to the reception staff that this was not a double but it was in fact a twin room. The receptionist said that this is what they called a double room. I told her that no hotel in the world calls two single beds a double room and their terminology was incorrect and that perhaps they should change the wording on the website. (After reading other reviews it seems this trick is pulled quite regularly). She wanted to charge me Â£50 to upgrade to an executive room. I refused. Eventually she said we could move the two beds together and that for our second night she would move us into a room with a double bed. We were kept awake most of the night by a dog barking in the next room that a woman had left locked inside. I CANNOT BELIEVE THAT THEY ALLOW PETS IN THE HOTEL ROOMS. I have never encountered this before. The next day our room took a long time to be ready. When we finally got the keys I noticed that it wasn't an executive room as it didn't have a whirlpool bath but it was in fact a deluxe room with a double bed (which is exactly what we had wanted in the first place). When we checked out, the receptionist tried to charge us for a dog in our room which was ironic! As we were getting ready to leave four poor jet-lagged americans had arrived and they couldn't find their reservation at the reception. They had to pay to use the internet to print out the confirmation of their booking. The reception staff were totally incompetent. I must add I found the restaurant/breakfast staff to be very helpful and friendly as were the bar staff. The same can't be said for the receptionist's who never smiled and rarely tried to help. To access the wi-fi is 17 euros for 24 hours. I've never had to pay for wi-fi in a 5* hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “Not really 5 star and not close”
Reviews.Author: Leah469
Reviews.Content: The write up said it was very central - which is not true - it's a 25 euro taxi ride - or a 6 stop on the tram. We specifically asked for a queen bed but were told they'd all sold out - sorry but they can't be guaranteed. The receptionist did find us another room for the following night however. The barman was in the bar, but he turned people away who wanted coffee because they were closed. Definitely NOT 5 star. Very bland service.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star??”
Reviews.Author: jjohnboy32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over the weekend with friends. Arrived early and although the rooms were not ready we did think that maybe they were but were putting us off a bit!! Anyway, we were told rooms would be ready at 3pm and they were. Rooms. OK, own air con, own (expensive) mini bar â‚¬7 for small vodka? Big comfortable bed, coffee and tea and bathrobes and slippers. Had to ask for an iron and extra pillows which took 2 hours to arrive!! We were on the from of the hotel and every hour on the hour some of the 'modern art' came to life in the park outside the window. It creaked, banged and rattled for 10 mins at a time..... Staff friendly enough and speak a variety of languages. Location was perfect with a 5 min walk to the tram stop for numbers 5, 1 and 24 which take you to central station. Last tram back is 12:30 am though and a taxi back would be a fortune. Drinks in hotel stop at 1am!!! Do not try and get another one!!! They won't! Breakfast is â‚¬18 for continental....... Classed as a 5star? More like a 4 star. Pleasant enough but wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Keithd001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel for 3 nights in July 2011 and pretty much loved everything about the hotel. Firstly the bedroom. Clean and very comfortable. Lovely sized bed. House keeping every day, although they did attempt to clean our room very early one morning but I partly blame myself for not putting the Do Not Disturb sign on the door! The area is ideal, it is out of the main manic area of Amsterdam, tram runs only about a 5 minute walk away but far enough away not to be able to hear. The usual links (Bus/Tram etc) are all very close by. Reception were very very helpful, good English. One minor complaint was no printer available to print off boarding passes for the flight home, but they were able to print off via their own PC's at the desk, but thats really nit picking!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, loved the neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: SKandSK
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a very eventful place, so it was nice to stay at a hotel in a calm beautiful neighbourhood (approx. 10min train ride to "central station" or walking distance to downtown if you enjoy nice long walks) Rooms : Spacious, clean, but I'm not a fan of carpets... Tiny TV, noisy AC. Hotel : Not very fancy, the hallways make it look cheap, but the lobby is pretty cute. Service : Fast check-in/check-out. No complaints! Surroundings : We fell in love with Apollolaan street. It's peaceful and lovely. There's a grocery store about 5 mins away, also a couple of little boutiques and restaurants. Overall, not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but watch payment method”
Reviews.Author: SonnyAndCher
Reviews.Content: I found this place to be a bit like an up-market Dutch travel lodge. Not amazing, but entirely functional, and given that there is whapping 5 star Hilton across the road, I guess it would be silly for them to act as a direct competitor. Nice little location. As others have stated, dont expect there to be a garden as such!!! That said, the Vondels Park is minutes up the road, and overall the location is fantastic to get into the centre and not far from the main road if you taxi in from the airport (about 40 euro). Rooms are simple - (be careful with the free-view of channel 35)....but nice and I got a few good nights rest there when its what I needed most. Breakfast good, better when they turn the toaster on, shower good, overall...good! Even the bike rental was reasonably priced and straight forward. Payment. Hmmm. As in all cases at hotels, when you check in, you have to give a deposit against room charges. 200!!! 200 Euro deposit!!! Blimey!!! Whatever you do, do not put this on American Express. When it comes to getting it back, turns out there card machines cannot refund Amex cards? huh? Then the night manager forgets to tell the day staff and vanishes... Overall, the location is the best thing about this hotel, and its good links. Everything else is rather average, so an average rating. Very nice staff, but not the most blinding with their service.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorkDaniel
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay very much.The staff were,friendly,helpful and very approachable. It was a relaxing experience. The location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful base in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Skotti56
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of four for two nights and booked the suite. The rate was pretty resonable and the accommodation was huge. Large lounge with sofa and two armchairs and a dining table for four. Two full bathrooms and a very comfortable king bed. The rooms have obviously been renovated recently and are of a very high standard. The bathrooms were not part of the upgrade and look a bit tired but were fine. Service was incredibly friendly and efficient. Breakfast was nice and the staff were particularly friendly. Special note to Sigourney who was charming. Minus is that the public areas are quite small and the outdoor space is really a patio on the street. However, the location is very quiet and peaceful but near to tram links when you need to get into the centre. We slept very well both nights. In summary, I would definitely stay there again but better for families and business people than those looking for a wild nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JackReacherFan
Reviews.Content: We had an overall good experience at this hotel. Our room was very clean and the neighbourhood very safe and quiet being slightly out of the hussle and bustle of the City Centre. However, the hotel is less than a 5min safe walk to a main tram stop into the City centre. Staff were very friendly and helpful in assisting us with transport information etc. The only negative we would say about our experience is that when we got home from our trip we discovered that they had incorrectly charged us for items from the mini-bar that we had not used! Very annoying!! However, overall we had a good experience at this hotel and would still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at walking distance from the city center.”
Reviews.Author: maat1n
Reviews.Content: It was all perfect . I would stay there again and again and again....:)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAG_68056
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems quite expensive for its standard, although this might just be a feature of the Amsterdam hotel market. On a sunday, the restaurant is closed and the room service phone line unstaffed (although the latter purports to be open on sundays on the room service menu).

Reviews.Title: “On a sultry July in sexually liberated Amsterdam, intense lessons in love come at the scenic Bilderberg Garden Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 060811d
Reviews.Content: I was not quite sure what to expect when I was dropped off at the hotel. It looked like an intimate hotel, located in the trendy suburbs of the city. It was an atypical setting from the one had in mind from the outset of the trip The entrance of the hotel had small dining areas located outside and inside the building. The outside cafe' dining had linen clothed tables setup with wicker chairs. The wine glasses were displayed upside down, almost as if they were anticipating the arrival of people that evening. The table clothes flew up as an unpredictable gust of wind wafted on the clear summer afternoon; the table setups tried to protect the modesty of the legs of the tables, but all of the attempts were in vain. Another small bar was set up with crystal wine glasses on a clean, white table cloth. They looked like a row of clear, glass tulips. The inside dining room was totally surrounded by glass door walls that were opened up to expose the large cherry slat wood floor. One really had to look closely to distinguish the inside from the outside, as no barriers seemed to exist. And it was at this hotel that an American woman's inhibitions, in the sultry July in sexually liberated Amsterdam, that intense lessons in love all came together in an intimate tale of romance & self discovery. Amsterdam leveled the playing field when it came to sexual inequality women face in America due to Puritanical judgement. No one could predict that the trip would entail embarking on the most intimate journey, encountering a European man and their unexpected adventure full of life & love lessons. The inside bar was small, intimate and full of people, on business and vacation, from all walks of life. Just sit at the bar and join people you do not know, to get to know the lives of others, in order to enjoy the real life. One can always take tours of museums and site seeing when they are retired on a tour guide. But for younger people wanting to explore, eat, drink, party and socialize, then this true Dutch Hotel is a good start. We loved Jazz and wanted to go to the Bimhaus in the Red Light District - but it was always closed. I would avoid the area of Leiderstraat unless you want to go to a casual area with a loud noises. The Orleans House is a great bar and has an eclectic menu and beautiful architectural structures. Near the hotel is an intimate Italian restaurant, the Bella Vista. It has seating in and outside the tree lined streets; the food and service is excellent. The Bilderberg Garden Hotel also boasts having a five star restaurant, which I can verify. Isn't life more interesting to go off the beaten path?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, silent located hotel with good public transport access”
Reviews.Author: SanderNorman
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Cozy room High quality beds Great breakfast with different types fresh baked bread (fantastic taste) Friendly personell Three nearby different tram routes that take you to a.o. the inner city center in 10 min. (you need a special chip card for public transport)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: gitsche_waller
Reviews.Content: We were booked in for 3 nights and it was amazing! All staff were extremely friendly and helped us with any and all questions we had. Breakfast is very good and offers lots of choices. It was also not very crowded which is nice as I personally hate a rushed breakfast (but lack of stress could be that the hotel was probably not fully booked). The spacious rooms offer everything you might need. The whirlpool tub is a big plus. The only (small) disadvantage is the location which is outside of the city. But about 5 minutes walking distance away is the next tram stop which takes you in the city centre (within 5-10 min).

Reviews.Title: “good sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: fabmc
Reviews.Content: Very good sleep quality at this hotel. Rooms are spacious and comfort level is high. Room windows are very big and can be opened on one side. Bathrooms are clean and modern, with good shower. It is a small, but quality Hotel about 10 minutes tram ride from Amsterdam Central Station (tram 24 and tram 5 to Apollolaan). Maybe they could add some color pictures inside rooms, as everything is white and beige, but that's a minor issue. I got a very good deal booking through Dutch booking service - www.hoteliers.com - and found a double room for Eur 125 per night, which is a good price for a good room in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, tram stop around the corner”
Reviews.Author: purple_swb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 10 mins from Dam square on the tram. It costs around â‚¬35 for a taxi from the airport. Its a lovely large reception area which houses the bar. There is also a large open fire for warming those toes after a winter stroll! The rooms are a little on the small side, but comfy beds. We didn't get breakfast included as it was too expensive however my brother was also staying with us & he got it but said it wasn't worth the money. So we went into a cafe in Dam square instead. Even though our booking advised that all taxes were included we were charged another tax on top. It was only a few euro but just be aware of it. Overall its a nice quiet hotel for a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great !”
Reviews.Author: TinaSingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bilderberg last week during my trip to Amsterdam and I must stay i simply loved the hotel ! ! Its located in the residential areas of Amsterdam as opposed to the touristy places but there are tram stations at walkable distance and I must say I loved the quiet ,calm , clean locality with its gingerbread houses ! The rooms were clean , beautiful and very very comfortable .The service at the desk great ! They did try to upgrade us to a bigger room for additional 25 euros but the standard rooms were as nice ! I loved the nice big windows ,the big bath and the spotless rooms ! ! It really made my first visit to Amsterdam special !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrRicw
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotel breaks I have had. The staff were friendly and more than willing to go out of the way to help. The rooms were well furnished and modern, and the jacuzzi bath was perfect after a cold days walk around Amsterdam. The is a tram stop 2 minutes walk away around the corner from the hotel which offers easy access to the city centre, but the local area is also well worth a visit for those little bakeries and cake shops that make a holiday special. There was a wide selection of breakfast foods available, all of which were most satisfying. I checked Trip Advisor before booking my stay and found the majority of these reviews to be accurate. I would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay away from the crowd in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Luca_Luo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little bit far away from the center (Dam Square). It's about 5 minutes walk to the nearest Tram station. We've got this hotel from bidding in the priceline, so we feel the hotel is rather nice to the value. The room is clean and relatively spacious compared to the European standard. The staff is friendly and quick during the check in / out process. But compared to other "5 star" hotels, this hotel is really a plain 5 star. The hotel is in a quiet neighbourhood and just beside the Hilton. Because it is the first time we went to Amsterdam, it's quite difficult for us to find a restaurant beside. It took about 20 minutes to walk to the Museum and fashion quarter where you can find a lot of shops and restaurants. Also, the Tram can easily take you to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Whirlpool bath didn't go to waste”
Reviews.Author: scottish-scouse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little out of the way however we came to appreciate this very quickly as it gave us the chance to explore the city in full and not just the immediate area to Dam Square. We had booked ballet tickets for Swan Lake on Christmas Day at the Europaplein and found that the hotel was just a mere 5 minute walk away. The trams were every 5 minutes - even on Christmas day they were operational every 12 mins. Check-in was done swiftly and with good customer service. They did give us the wrong room however this was rectified promptly and the front desk staff apologised profusely. Our room had a whirlpool bath, which was one of the reasons we booked it, and it was put to use every night to warm us up after our day of snow filled sight seeing. I was disappointed that although the hotel is a 5 star it didn't have any leisure facilities although you could use the facilities at their 4 star sister hotel. My only gripe was the maid service insisted on knocking on our door every morning to make up our room. I even hung the "do not disturb" sign from our door and guess what they still knocked! No rest for the wicked then! Overall opinion, i would stay in this hotel again but i may bring my own pillow!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location and great restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: Wilfried1900
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a superb location in Amsterdam. Really close to the shopping areas and museums. Outstanding relation price / quality. The restaurant De kersentuin located in the hotel is a must do! Great service and fine food!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a 5-star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Karen D
Reviews.Content: My young adult daughter and I spent a long weekend at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel. We could not have been happier! Great location in a quiet neighborhood, tram just around the corner, tram tickets available at reception desk. Very courteous and helpful staff. Rooms are clean and very comfortable. Turn down service with fresh fruit each night. Parking on site in a covered carport for a nominal fee (much higher in the city center). Definitely recommend and will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, we'll definitely be back for a fourth visit”
Reviews.Author: JMD70
Reviews.Content: This is the third Christmas we've used Bilderberg Garden Hotel as our base to visit family and as on previous visits, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel offers excellent value and great five star service, particularly when compared with other smaller, more impersonal hotels in the center of Amsterdam. The rooms are spacious - in our experience more so than others, particularly the executive rooms. The breakfast was varied, plentiful & delicious. The hotel is not located right in the center of Amsterdam, however, it is only a very short tram ride away from all the main attractions. In our opinion, the hotel's location is a benefit since it means we have a 5 star hotel, with spacious rooms, at a very affordable price. We were particularly impressed with the hotel this time round as a result of the flexibility they offered when our flight to Amsterdam was canceled due to the snow at Heathrow. We'd pre paid our hotel reservation via Expedia back in Oct and booked at a rate which prohibited changes or cancellation. When our flight was canceled the hotel could have simply refused to help & we'd have been stuck having to pay for another reservation. However, they were very reasonable and helped us as much as possible. As a result, we were able to re-book with no penalty and thus, we were extremely grateful for their help, professionalism and flexibility in difficult circumstances. This is a really great hotel & we'll definitely be back in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: 186342Paul
Reviews.Content: Finding this hotel on the internet was a gem. 5star comfort and service. Breakfast was superb. Rooms on the Executive floor overlooking the green are great and with its own direct lift make it special. Yes the hotel is 15 mins from Dam Sqaure via the tram make it a peaceful location. Stayed in the best hotels in Amsterdam but this is 5star first class. Book your self a trip !.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: Pericoloso
Reviews.Content: this is a lovely hotel situated in the south of the city, close to the museum area and th Pijp. It is in a quiet residential street . Prices are lower than comparable establishments, because it is a bit off the beaten track, but it was actually vey pleasant to be somewhere quiet after busy days doing the museums and other attractions and it is only about 5 minutes from trams which will take you into the centre in 10 minutes. The hotel boast a highly rated restaurant (Kersentuin), which is also used for breakfast, which is excellent. N.B. breakfast is 22 euros, but if booked in advance the price is discounted to 15 euros. The staff are all very helpful and welcoming and my room was well-appointed, quiet and comfortable. I would definitely choose the Bilderberg Garden Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I wish the rooms were as nice as the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: piernicola
Reviews.Content: Two days ago I told the taxi driver that I was going to the Bilderberg Garden Hotel and her reply was: "ooohhh, fancy!". Needless to say I was extra excited for that... The hotel lobby was really nice. The service was amazing all the time. The only problem.... the ROOMS! They were a bit old (old TV, old carpet, old bathroom) and definitely not a match to what I was expecting. It's a positive overall experience, as long as don't expect any luxury in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsteve12
Reviews.Content: The hotel not in the main part of town, but just a minute walk to the train stop and a short ride to the main part of town. The neighborhood is clean and seems to be safe. The staff was helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient staff at the check-in”
Reviews.Author: A6FEQ948
Reviews.Content: Staff gives you the feeling that they are happy to see you. They check in quickly while the hall porter takes care of your luggage and your car. The rooms are clean and have the usual five star equipment. The location is okay; a tram stop at walking distance and not more then a 15 minutes walk to the shopping areas. Excellent breakfast buffet in restaurant De Kersentuin. If we visit Amsterdam and need a hotel, we stay most of the times in the Bilderberg Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Bilderberg Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannyt75
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel friendly staff rooms are excellent bed are really comfortable stayed in a executive room highly recommand

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - dreadful housekeeping......”
Reviews.Author: suzdal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister for 3 nights and on arrival all was great. We were given an early check in which was very welcome as we'd been travelling since 2.30am. However, things went a bit down hill from there. The room itself was fine but the toiletteries were cheap and badly stocked. Our biggest gripe was the standard of housekeeping. The room was not properly cleaned during the day - dirty wine glasses not washed, bottles not removed and floor not vacumed. The coffee etc were not replenished. On requesting an iron on the 2nd morning, it took 3 calls and 55 minutes to arrive. Similarily, i waited 45 minutes for an adaptor plug. The reception staff were friendly but apart from 1, they were not very helpful about places to eat in the neighbourhood. All in all, the hotel was clean and quiet but I don't think i'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel ...restaurant has some room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: letsplaysquash
Reviews.Content: My son (16) and I have just returned from a short stay at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Bilderberg and our experience of Amsterdam. We were fortunate in accessing a very good package deal at the hotel (inc breakfast on 2 mornings and 1 evening dinner for both of us) which in the main was very very good value for money. From Schipol airport, the hotel which is tucked away in a highly desirable Amsterdam suburb of pristine streets, tree lined avenues, tidy homes, delighful shops, tasty eateriees and tranquility beyond any that I has experienced in any other European city, is just a short bus ride/taxi ride away (Connexion Hotel shuttle is 15 euro per person which I thought a little expensive but worth it to avoid the hasstle) . The tram network is very close by and the city centre, museums, churches, cathedrals, galleries and all other places of interest are within a short trip - pick up a 24 hour tram ticket (7 euros per person)from hotel reception and save yourself a bundles of euros! Check-in when we arrived was conducted in an effortless fashion by a trainee receptionist and when she did have a slight problem the reception manager Zoe was on hand immediately to smooth over and rectify the minor issue - wonderful - we all have to learn and this young lady was certainly getting an excellent mentoring from the manager at reception! The hotel rooms are spacious and comfortable, nice beds and bedding (excellent pillows) with plenty of towels, toiletries, tea/coffee, information and use of robes and lounging slippers. Breakfast is a very adequate buffet giving plenty of choice in terms of cereals, breads (both sweet and savoury), fruit, hams, cheeses, yogurts, juices, eggs (although the boiled eggs are more cool than hot, but each to their own) and warm rather than hot are the sausages/musrooms and grilled tomatoes. I would love to be able to report on the quaility of the food in the restaurant in the evening but unfortunately even though we were scheduled to have dinner we didn't! I booked dinner for early evening, indeed we were so early, we were infact the first guests to present to eat. Eating off the 'set menu' (from the package) prooved impossible for me as it was less than expansive given that there was only 3 main courses to choose from - not bad you might say - but given that they were all fish dishes, not much good if you are allergic to fish as I am! The waiter did ask the chef if there was any additional choicewhich could be offered - there was, 1, which was 'beef tail' - not the best cut of meat and certainly not for my pallete. The only other option that was then offered was the opportunity to choose from the 'a la catre' menu at an additional charge - which given the cost involved in this 'upgrade', was nt an option at all. As my son was not going to eat on his own we decided to forego the 'dinnin experience' at dinner and on hearing this the waiter was absolutely incredulous and was clearly less than pleased, to say he was 'miffed' and had a little 'huff' to himself would be an understatement - but I am made or sterner stuff than that and was not about to be intimidated into selecting food that I knew i couldn't or wouldn't eat. We left and found a wonderful restaurant within 5 minutes walk where we both ate for less than the cost it would have been for 1 of us to upgrade to the 'a la carte' menu at the hotel. I don't doubt that the food at the hotel would have been superb (as at breakfast) but the chef needs to realise that offering 3 variations of one meat genre is not offering real choice. A little more training for the waiter in the finer art of customer care and speaking only when required to, would not go amiss. I would also recommend another wonderful 'eateree' , Cafe Leoitja very close by, as the best steak I have eaten in a very long time - mmmmmmmmmmmmmm! Checking out from the hotel was destined to be a problem as the receptionist was not prepared to provide for a discount for the inability of the restaurant to offer a suitable meal choice for our dinner, but I am afraid that this reviewer was not abut to accept that position. I asked for the opportunity to speak to the reception manager and as if by magic, Zoe (above) apeared - 5 minutes later - an agreed discount and check out copmpleted, tidyily and efficiently - WELL DONE Zoe! My ratings for the hotel are: Hotel overall - 9/10, Breakfast quality - 8/10, Dinner - no suitable choice of food on the 'set menu' and little flexibility make this a very poor 4/10 for me - but I believe that other reviewers may feel much more positive with good justification. Come on Chef - be aware that not all guests can eat everything! I loved this hotel dispite the issue above and Zoe does deserve special mention for her diligence, flexibility, efficiency and abilty to turn potentially damaging situations around effectively. I will reuse this hotel if not the restaurant 'set menu' package!

Reviews.Title: “Just as good a year on.”
Reviews.Author: natbrad
Reviews.Content: Excellent once again a year on.We got a great deal which included breakfast,which we found very good and kept us going until lunch. The location of the hotel, is our favourite area in amsterdam, with easy access to the centre.The staff leave you to enjoy your break, but are there for you if you have any quieries.Thank you to all the Bilderberg staff and see you again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Mia576
Reviews.Content: During our stay at this hotel we encountered rude staff members, a wait of 40 mins for our dinner at the restaurant and a bathroom which leaked whist the shower was in use. Additionally, we were over-charged for wifi Internet access. When we approached the reception to lodge a complaint, the staff simply dismissed our concerns. As we are extensive travelers, this hotel would be one of our worst experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at the Bilderberg”
Reviews.Author: foot106
Reviews.Content: A warm atmosphere to the entrance of the hotel.Friendly reception staff.Any questions or worries were taken care of.Advice on the rail service was provided in one case.Pedro who was attentive to the guests needs.The bar staff making you feel at ease.Nothing was too much trouble.The cleaning staff were always friendly.A nice touch was the apple that was delivered to the room late afternoon.The breakfast times were a real delight.Thomas who i met was such a pal.It was a shame when he had to go on holiday and i could not see a picture of his family.Isabella Berkhout who was on the breakfasts was a real star.Isabella was courteous and very helpful at breakfasts.She even knew when the coffee pot was empty before i knew.So give her a big pat on the back for me.Overall it was a lovely hotel in a lovely part of amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay - Friendly staff - Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: cloonacool
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here went for new years eve 2009. The room was very good and very clean. The staff were very helpfully too and top marks to the staff. Location was a bit far out from the town centre but we got passes to use the tram. Great place to stay but poor location. They Added in a city tax too that we did not know about on top of our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: AntwerpGuyke
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff. Stopping place just a 5 min walk. Tickets available in the hotel, even for a museum. Nice, quiet room. Good breakfast. A nice place to stay for a visit in town.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in amsterdan, very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dry_carvalho
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience in this hotel, the staff is very professional and they treat very good! The neighbourhood in pretty quite and fancy, we took pleasant walks and biking to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a super location!”
Reviews.Author: jbtwee
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in this hotel. The location was great. In a quiet, shady part of the city but only 10 minutes walk to the city-centre and 5 minutes to the Vondelpark. A various delicious breakfastbuffet. I will certainly recommend this hotel to others and hope to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with a car park in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Decner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night. Rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The location was good, about 10 mins walk from the museums. Having a car park was a bonus for us.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Blondii
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience here. This hotel was more affordably priced than many others in its class. Although rated as a 5 star, it was more like a 4. It is located in a lovely neighborhood in a quiet area. It is a few blocks from the tram stop, which was very convenient. You can buy tram passes at reception. The hotel was modern and updated. Our room was clean and nice, but not fancy. We had a big window. It was very quiet every night. We just had a couple of complaints about the room: no drawers and very few hangers. The staff was friendly and helpful. The parking area was small, but we had reserved a spot (this is necessary) and the doorman parked the car for us when needed. It worked out well. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but ordered room service one night. It was prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Philip519
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice. Accomodation is a little bit dated but the friendly and efficient staff make up for the accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kindredspirits
Reviews.Content: This is certainly a nice hotel, large rooms, comfy beds, very quiet and peaceful and could be ideal for those not too interested in a quick Amsterdam trip wanting to see many of the sights and enjoying some nightlife. It is located far from the city center, a good distance below Vondel Park. We booked via Hotwire fpr $159US/night (comes to $180/night once taxes are added) and didn't get to see which hotel before we booked, but requested the central section of Amsterdam. Not sure how this made it to "central' but this is the first time Hotwire has let us down. The hotel is located in a very nice quiet residential section, removed from everything. Two trams reach the closest stop (#5 & 24) which is about 3 blocks away from the hotel. From the train station, it is about a 20 minute ride to that stop. The 5 minute walk from there to the hotel was picturesque. We did appreciate the fact that we had the opportunity to see a piece of Amsterdam that we would have never otherwise seen. Our room was a double, but it was 2 separate single beds. They did move us to a more comfortable arrangement for our 2nd night, which was very nice of them. The Hotel itself was probably the best of our entire trip. The area around the hotel was great. The staff seemed very pleasant. It just wasn't located in a convenient proximity to the city center for us, and reaching a bike rental place, or the train station for our day trip to Haarlem (and our trip to Prague) or a nearby cafe in the morning, or dinner in the Jordaan area (which we love) was very frustrating. I am sure that this would be a perfect place for many, but for us the logistics detracted to the point that we wouldn't choose to stay here again, especially if we only visit for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay in this lovely and calm hotel with a very professional crew”
Reviews.Author: Crommelinck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary in this lovely hotel. The welcome was warm with a personal touch and congratulations with our wedding anniversary (multiple times during our stay). Everyone was always happy to help us and made us feel as real VIP guests. The breakfast was delicious and their restaurant "De Kersentuin" is really top. We had a great dinner in the restaurant. Not only the food was excellent but also the waiters were really top. If you want a relaxing weekend in a great hotel with fantastic crew ... The Bilderberg Garden Hotel is the place to be !!!!

Reviews.Title: “good bed, good breakfast, friendly staff, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: bollechie
Reviews.Content: Lots of value for money, kind people good food, decent rooms and very good beds. Location of the hotel very central. Really recommendable for those who wanna do Amsterdam. Central yet quiet !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Godott
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, friendly, comfortable place to stay with everything you could possibly need. It is not downtown, but the 20-30 minute walk is scenic and riddled with cafes, bakeries and great shops. There is an expensive, but I imagine wonderful restaurant downstairs. There is also less expensive food options like soups and sandwiches available at the bar. Real nice touch: room service came to my door ever day and gave me two freshly picked apples. The only complaint I have about this hotel is that they charge for WiFi access BY THE HOUR!. Come on, it's the 21Century: Internet access is no longer some rarefied thrill to be reserved for the few select people who happen to have one of those "new fangled portable computing devices". It is a requirement for the modern traveller. If I had of been held-up in my hotel room for some reason, WIFI access here would have cost me more than the room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Bilderberg has it pros and cons, but all in all it's an OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndersRiedel
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a couple of nights back i August 2009. Had some meetings in Amsterdam and the weather was nice, so we walked to the city everyday, but it took 20 minutes or so and in bad weather you would have to go by bus or taxi. Located next to Hilton in a neighborhood that can be characterized as suitable for upper class residents of Amsterdam and Businesses. I would probably book Hilton the next time depending on the price or perhaps something closer to the City center - There were several charming hotels in the city center, but since the weather was nice we stayed in the Hilton garden after our meetings and enjoyed the tranquility there and the boats passing by instead. The Bilderberg didn't have the same charm but the staff was very service minded towards me and my companion while my colleague had to wait quite a while for a room (even though it seemed like they had several available rooms despite our early arrival). The breakfast was OK, not exceptional and the same goes for the small cafe serving coffee outside the hotel. The staff provided us with an excellent service later on though, as we had booked a table at a restaurant and was running a bit late, but that was expected as the only reason we booked a table in the first place was because the restaurant at the hotel was closed down for renovation and the room came with a free dinner at the hotel restaurant. The restaurant they referred us to was Chinese and the food was excellent there, so no biggie! On a side note I had some problems with the Internet, as the only place you could get access to the Wi-Fi was in the lobby - Otherwise you had to pay for it and use a cable and I simply don't accept that you have to pay for Internet access - it should always be complimentary and that is why I often tend to look at Radisson hotels before researching the rest of the market.

Reviews.Title: “Educational trip for kids”
Reviews.Author: HWHToolman
Reviews.Content: Yes this place is Squared Away, I have spent the last 18 years in the US Army and wanted my 13 year old to see how easy and nice it is to travel and this place lived up to all I wanted to show her. Close 2 minutes from tram, really close to the museums, the staff had all the maps and tram tickets, every thing one could want. We went to Anne Franks house, Van Gough museum, Zoo, open markets and all you have to do is ask the front desk they had all the info. I will return. Ret. E-7 Doug Gillespie

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: mctarr
Reviews.Content: The location is in close proximity to the Van Gogh and Rijks Museum. We were traveling for business and found the local restaurant choices excellent, with a variety of menus and prices. All of our meals, from pizza to fine dining were excellent. The front desk was excellent. They noticed it was raining and stopped us at the door to provide umbrellas for our walk to the restaurant area. With a tight schedule, the front desk was able to check the train schedules, museum hours and provide taxi's when needed. We were able to visit the musueums, enjoy the local fare and conduct business on a very demanding time frame. Excellent rooms and in-house restaurant as well.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable bed, quiet leafy location”
Reviews.Author: MKA_UK
Reviews.Content: Visited Amsterdam in April/May for art/museums/tulips. Glad we chose this location as it is out of the centre, down a very pleasant and quiet street - not far on the tram back to the action though. Tram stop only 5 mins walk. Booked a suite on expedia - found that it was not on executive floor as expected. Rooms were decorated as executive rooms, but were 2 rooms on the 1st floor at the end of a corridor which had an interconecting door. One room was usual bedroom with large double, and 2nd room had a dining table, sofabed, 2nd minibar and 2nd TV. Had a view of the top of the restaurant, and car parking spaces unfortunately, but didn't matter as weren't there much.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: kalikos
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Bilderberg Garden Hotel'. The room we had was extremely comfortable and the decor was warm, welcoming and very clean. On arrival we were given the opportunity to upgrade our room (25E per night). We did upgrade to the executive suite, however I don't think that it was really necessary - then again when your on holiday its always good to treat yourself!!! The bed was ever so comfortable, so much so that we slept in until midday and kept missing our alarms. Make sure that you familiarise yourself with maps because it is very easy to get lost and the Biderberg Garden hotel is a little out of the way. We got lost one evening and not many local people could help us out when we asked if they knew the hotel. PPl seemed to know the apollolann street near the hotel. But it is well worth noting the surroundings and using a map!!!!! Lastly, if you want to go to the museums make sure that you go really early or later in the afternoon. I've never seen ques so long! They were so long that we didn't visit them - very dissappointing! So we ended up spending our short stay drinking (expensive) beer and eating (expensive) food - However, largely because of the state of the exchange rate. Also the first week of Jan is local holidays and not an aweful lot of establishments are open. Apart from that enjoy and I give this hotel 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel slightly off the beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: fusionista1
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam several times. This was my first time to stay at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel. The rooms were great, the hotel was clean and the staff was fantastic. The only problem is the location is just outside the city center. For me, I prefer to be in the action. Don't get me wrong, the area where the hotel is located is a beautiful residential area only 2 tram stops from Mueseumplein. The tram stop is about a 4 or 5 minute walk from the hotel and for most people, this is perfect and I recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, spacious and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Vastenb
Reviews.Content: Hotel situated in a quiet street. Spacious rooms and friendly personel. Tasty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, very good service, we had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: friesevlag
Reviews.Content: Good location (of course depending on where you want to be), great offers during the weekend so you can have a very good stay (including very good breakfeast) for a good price. Good rooms, great service.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing city trip”
Reviews.Author: houben
Reviews.Content: very good hotel with friendly staff, nice rooms very good breakfast, 15 min walk to the centre .. tip : leave your car in front of the hotel, the public transport is great and takes you anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “The ideal hotel for our visits to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: I_DAntwerp
Reviews.Content: Bilderberg Garden is a very nice place, the staff is as friendly as can be, the rooms are spacious enough, the food is very fine and the location of the hotel is just perfect for us, near the Museum area and the Concertgebouw, streets with fine shops etc., and situated in a quiet nabourhood with an interesting architecture, not very far (at walking distance) from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for combining work and leasure”
Reviews.Author: glushka
Reviews.Content: This was a very comfort variant for us, because the conference we participated was held in the hotel, so we could save a lot of time. The cuisine was excellent! Gourmet items were real masterpieces! A big deal is that breakfast was included (also delicious). Rooms are neat and cleaned in time. The staff is very friendly and ready to help. This is no-smoking hotel, however it was not laborious to go outdoors and enjoy a cigarette in a pretty open lounge. Situated in a park zone, the hotel is protected from noise and fuss of central streets. But souvenir shops, museums and restaurants are 5 minutes from the hotel and you can get to the center in 10 minutes by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “for sure not a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Beeb9
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel last w-end. got a hot deal on ratestogo.com for a deluxe room. service not worst a 5 stars hotel. no robe, no slippers!!! small old bathroom. could hear the noise next door. not nice to be waken up at 7.00 on a sunday morning by the noise of the showers next door !!! not worst even the discounted price (got a deal of approx 60 % off normal price). as a comparison the suite hotel, which I've experienced in other countries, is cheaper and far much better!!!! would NOT stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: herculeanprospect
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Garden Hotel for five days during August 2009 on our first visit to Amsterdam. We purchased a train/tram/bus ticket from the tourist information desk at the airport and found the journey from the airport to the hotel by train/no5 tram and a ten minutes walk, with our cases, to be very easy. The Garden Hotel is top class, with more than adequate numbers of well trained staff who were very helpful. The bedrooms were clean and cleaned every day. The breakfast area was sunny and pleasant with a wide variety of breakfast food, hot and cold, (the chef cooked two fried eggs each day for us).The waiting staff were fast and efficient. The Garden Hotel is located in a quiet area just a ten minutes stroll down the Reiynier Vinkeleskade, alongside the canal, to the tram stop. The tram services are frequent and efficient. The no5 tram goes to central station via a lot of the points of interest and it is easy to get off and on. All in all we found the Garden Hotel and Amsterdamians to be very nice and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! We will stay here again on future trips.”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoozer
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Bilderberg Garden hotel. We arrived from the airport VERY early in the morning (our flight landed early) and we were greeted at our taxi by the doorman ready to help us with our bags. We were checked in immediately and everyone was so friendly and helpful and we received a welcome package containing a map and brochures for several excursions. Every single person we interacted with on the hotel staff was courteous and friendly and did whatever they could to accomodate us. And everyone spoke perfect English. The room was clean and comfortable with a large double bed. The bathroom was very clean. The room also had a minibar and room service was available 24 hours a day. Room service was very fast and delicious. The restaurant in the hotel was excellent. We had an amazing four course meal that was one of the highlights of our trip. Obviously, we are not the only ones who thought so. The restaurant was very popular on weekend nights. The lounge was also very comfortable for an evening drink. We regret we didn't come down there more often as there were comfortable couches and chairs to relax in to plan your next day of sightseeing. Food was also available in the lounge - more of a bar food menu. The hotel was just a short walk (2 blocks) from a tram stop that would take you right into the heart of the city on two different lines. Trams came every 10-15 minutes or so and with two lines, you were sure to get where you were going quickly. Also, the museum district was in walking distance if you wanted a stroll. It was a pretty walk. Tram tickets (24 hour, 48 hour or 72 hour) were availalbe at the front desk of the hotel for purchase too as well as tickets to museums. Some people say it was too far from the center of the city but frankly I liked that - it was a quiet and safe neighborhood and it felt nice to come to that instead of a hotel on a busy loud street in the center of things. And I never felt like it was too far from anything. We would absolutely return here again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: scho19
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in the hotel, because we visited a concert in the Concertgebouw. It was all close by and we had a reserved parking-place for our car with our name on it. That is what I understand about service and hospitality .Also the personal was helpfull and friendly, especially in the restaurant. In short, the hotel was very good and we like to come back next time.

Reviews.Title: “more than value for mnoney”
Reviews.Author: porthand
Reviews.Content: nice and good hotel, not quite new, but up to standard. clean, well maintained, quiet room included all standard facilities. located very near the centre of the city, friendly and helpfull service. good restaurant "de kersentuin"

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: adolmans
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the hotel - the rooms were super spacious with large, comfortable beds and a jacuzzi in the bathroom. Everything was super-clean, and the small extras (great-smelling shampoos and shower gels, coffee/tea/cookies in the room, etc) really made it that little bit nicer. Staff were extremely helpful, from renting bikes to paying and placing your daily parking ticket in the car for you. A little bit pricier than what I would normally go for (and still a 20-min walk from the center) but otherwise great value-for-money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, very friendly staff, spotless hotel”
Reviews.Author: malikannabi
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel via Booking.com, mainly for its good rate and for the availability of a parking space. When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the public spaces and the rooms. The hotel is spotless. In addition the staff is quite friendly, which I experienced even before arriving when I called the reception to recommend that they take good care of our friend who was arriving before us by train from Paris. The reception staff was extremely helpful throughout our stay as well, with their advice on restaurants, sightseeing, etc ... The quality of the breakfast buffet was excellent. The restaurant staff was also quite friendly. Finally, the only negative comment was the limited number of TV channels in the room, at least for me as I am always looking for Euronews, BBC News, ... Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but it should be for the price”
