Reviews.Author: sandmanjj
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel at the border of Amsterdam. It doesn't take long to go to the city, public transportation is only a few minutes away. The staff is rather cold like expected in a bussiness hotel. The breakfast is very good and so is the restaurant. I had an upgraded room and was very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: TG_Borgen
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at Bilderberg Garden Hotel during our stay for 4 days in Amsterdam. The staff were great and most helpful in every aspect. The break-fest close to perfect, but the grand finally was the hotel restaurant.... To summarize: staff, service level, atmosphere, environment and quality of the food/wine equals heaven. But as the title reveals, "close to perfection".. getting to Dam Square by trolley takes about 12 minutes. I would gladly recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues, and will use it again the next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RunerChickie
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. Its location, right on the canal, makes for a beautiful setting, and it is easy to get to by public transportation. It was also quick to get into the centre part of Amsterdam, but not at all loud. It had the feel of being sort of suburban, while still being close to the action. The staff is wonderful- smiles, very welcoming and very helpful in giving directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. Our room was clean and quiet, and the bed was very comfortable. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel made the break great!”
Reviews.Author: jvjwent
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything it promised to be. About 3 km from the centre, it was in a very pleasant area ,close to a canal with nice walks. Travelling round the city from the hotel was easy - either by tram or walking, and we bought the tram tickets from Reception, which was brilliant. The quality of service - bar service, Reception, housekeeping and restaurant - was of the highest standard, efficient, friendly but unobtrusive. Breakfast was excellent at the hotel and the choice of local restaurants for dinner was impressive. We had a problem on departure when our Connexxions Shuttle bus failed to turn up but the Hotel staff did everything they could to solve the problem for us. We would certainly stay in the Garden Hotel again and indeed hope to do so in the future. Thank you Bilderberg for a lovely break.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wildplys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel for 3 nights and had a great stay. The hotel is located about 3 km away from the center of Amsterdam but within a few minutes walk you can get on to the tram no. 5, 15 or 24 taking you straight to the center of the city. The hotel is in a very nice neighbourhood with the museum and fashion district in walking distance. Parking is â‚¬24 per day but you can use the Park and Ride facilities in the nearby Olympisch Stadion and pay only â‚¬6 per day. You dont need your car when getting around Amsterdam anyway. We went on a 4 days/3 nights deal with breakfast included + 1 dinner at a nearby restaurant. We didnt have high expectations for the dinner but it turned out that we had a fantastic 3 course meal in one of the better restaurants in Amsterdam. Try it out, it is named "Spring" and located 10 minutes walk from the hotel. I would rate the hotel as follows: Location 3 of 5 (but you know this before you go) Staff 5 of 5 Room 5 of 5 Cleanliness 5 of 5 Breakfast 3 of 5 (great buffet but a 5 for me is something like Hilton buffet) General comfort 5 of 5 Area/Neighbourhood 5 of 5 Overall 4 of 5 We paid a total of â‚¬392 for 3 nights breakfast included and 1 dinner at restaurant Spring. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but too far from city center”
Reviews.Author: Pingla
Reviews.Content: The Bilderberg Garden is a ok hotel. We booked it through hotwire.com and got a good price. I would never have paid full price. It's not that nice. The first room we stayed in was fairly spacious with a good bed. The next two nights we upgraded to an executive room. This room was much bigger, but the bathroom was actually smaller. But the upgrade was only â‚¬30. Otherwise the hotel is very expencive. â‚¬10 for 1 hour with wireless internett. The breakfast was â‚¬22. But there is a refrigerator in the room, so we had food in there. The hotel is situated outside the city center, 20 minutes by tram from the central station and about 10 minutes from Leidesplein. The closest tram station from the hotel is just 3 minutes. And the tram leaves every 5 min. But it is to far to walk to the city center. I think this is the biggest problem with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel will be back next year”
Reviews.Author: natbrad
Reviews.Content: Went on a three day break, found the Hotel very clean and relazing. Room was cleaned twice a day and the staff were very helpfull. Tram stop round corner 5/24 which will take you straight into town (never waited for more than 5 mins) Vondelpark is a must, and is a 10 min walk from the hotel. 5 star Hotel with 5 star surroundings. Cant wait for next year !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for what I paid, but kinda far from the action”
Reviews.Author: nonstoptravelNYC
Reviews.Content: After reading the extensive and conflicting reviews of this hotel, I ended up with a reservation here after a bid on Hotwire. Considering I got it for $260 US for TWO nights (about 92 Euros/night, including tax!!) I really can't complain at all. We got off on the wrong tram and had a long walk full of expletives on the way there, but when we got there realized the actual stop is only about 3-5 min. Actually, even that is slightly annoying but really not bad. Upon arrival, there were no problems, and they immediately offered us an 'executive' upgrade for 25 euros/night, which I declined (this seemed slightly sketchy somehow) They also informed us that breakfast was 22 euros, but if you booked in advance it was only 15. I was hesitant, but it seemed convenient and we booked it. A good decision as the breakfast buffet is really excellent - everything from Belgian waffles to lox. No, it's not the best, best ever, but for 15 euros, was very lovely, friendly staff, and they didn't hit you with any extras. They even have free mimosas! In terms of location, the area is suburban and very lovely, but kind of far from the central area. Now mind you Amsterdam is small and frankly you could walk still walk here from Central Station in probably 30-40 min, but it would have been nice to be closer. Plus, if you are out past midnight (which I pretty much always am) the only way home is taxi, which ends up being in the 12-14 euro area. Would have been much nicer to just walk home. However, aside from that, the place is quite nice. Lobby is lovely and modern. There is a bar and very nice and chic eating area outside. Staff doesn't seem that well trained (I agree with other reviews on this) but generally friendly and helpful - certainly not overly so, however. One reviewer said the water pressure was bad - my shower had more pressure than anywhere else in Europe that i have stayed! Might have been because I was on the first floor. Rooms are not nearly as nice as the lobby - probably on the level of a medium-sized city Holiday Inn. But clean and certainly quite decent. Bathroom was spotless and nice lotions and such. One other sketchy thing - when I checked out, they had added a 6 euro 'internet booking' fee. I'm sure this is totally outside of the hotwire agreement, but it wasn't a lot and I was simply not up to arguing about it. I might call Hotwire and see what they say. Oh, and internet is expensive - very annoying. Won't stay here again, but mostly because of location.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here again. Quiet comfort, great staff and well appointed ameneties.”
Reviews.Author: relsey0602
Reviews.Content: Uncomplicated comfort in a clean, well maintained, quiet atmosphere. Rooms were designed for simple, comfortable luxury with good proportional amenities. Hotel location was good to World Trade Center complex, tram and train access points to/from airport as well as near by local eateries with great food. The service staff was outstanding and professional - special acknowledgement to Lucas N. who was courteous, knowledgeable and exceptional in his accommodation to guest requests and making this American feel comfortable about venturing out and navigating the unfamiliar city of Amsterdam. His recommendations on local eateries, hot spots, and must sees really enhanced the value of my week long stay. The Bilderberg Garden Hotel has found a successful formula. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “NOT 5 star but ok”
Reviews.Author: lilolme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, clean, a bit tired in places, poor water pressure for the shower, staff who have obviously had very little or no training but who seem friendly enough, mediocre room service food, expensive rates, little in the way of facilities, nice area near a tram stop, I'm sure you can get the picture. I think they probably get a lot of guests on the back of the Hilton being full. Would I recommend it, maybe for a business trip when you don't need much more than it offers but probably not for anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Located in an amazing area”
Reviews.Author: 6panda
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the hotel. It's an exclusive area with beutiful private villas. Tram 5 or 24 would take you to the center in a 5-7 minutes. If you want to relax after a busy day, go there. If you need crowds shouting under your hotelroom take another hotel. It's up to you. The hotel stuff would make a 50-euro reservation for every single night, so have enough cash or credit on your card. The breakfast price is 22 euro/person a day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harlister
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were very friendly, polite. All of our requests were met. When we entered our room we found the mini-bar had been left open, and unfortunately the contents were not chilled. However, some chilled drinks were bought up to us immediately and were not charged to our room. The room was very spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable and the maid service was very prompt. Breakfast was a good selection and the service in the restaurant was friendly and efficient. The location is in a very nice residential area, however it may be a little far out for some guests. But for people wishing to see a nice residential area, it is within a comfortable walking distance of all the attractions, with plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. Overall, I would highly recommend this Hotel, we had a very pleasant and memorable stay. Thank you very much Bilderberg Gardne Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: RoaminRev
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel in the internet at very reasonable rates but we were afraid of what we would find after some recent reviews. Neither we, nor the friends we were travelling with could find a single fault. The staff were extremly friendly and helpful and the rooms a delight to stay in. ItThe hotle lived up to its five star rating in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to 5* standards”
Reviews.Author: JacGalway
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in this hotel last noverber as a weekend away. Got a good deal over the internet & was happy to hear it was 5*. On arrival in amsterdam city we got a cab to the hotel which cost us â‚¬30 which i thought was a bit much seen as hotel isn't that far from city. Check in went smoothly but when we went into our room we noticed the bed was to single beds pushed together & would move apart if sat on. I went back down to repection where a manager (who hadn't a clue what he was doing)told me the hotel was full and then apoligised & suddenly an executive suite just became available. We jumped at the chance only later to be told it would be an extra â‚¬50?In the Exuective suites we were told there would be a jacuzzi. Don't be fooled the Jacuzzi was a very very small bath This was the only problem i had with this hotel.The rest of my stay was wonderful.But would not stay in the bilderberg hotel.Definetly not 5*

Reviews.Title: “From very pleasant to HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: jannaklein
Reviews.Content: As a former regular client of the Bilderberg Garden Hotel (I stay here 4 to 8 times a year), I am saddened to announce its fatal decline. This hotel has become a nightmare for its guests, combining shoddy housekeeping, poor maintenance and inferior service, with an unresponsive and irresponsible management. Don't wast you money on this hotel, at any price! There are many fine hotels in Amsterdam that are worthy of your patronage. The Bilderberg Garden Hotel is NO longer one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: XYZ_2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quieter more residential area of Amsterdam, but it is close (walking distance) to the Rijks and Van Gogh museums. There's parking (a relatively rare commodity in city center Amsterdam), the design is modern and spacious, and the service is good. FYI -- the hotel has a sister property closer to the museum area (but no parking).

Reviews.Title: “OK at half the price”
Reviews.Author: JT14
Reviews.Content: To put in context, my bill for 1 night with breakfast and a room service burger was â‚¬300. At that price, this is a very disappointing hotel. Plus side: - great neighborhood - smallish hotel Negatives: - breakfast was â‚¬20 with mediocre quality of food and staff who, when you could get their attention, seemed irritated to be asked for espresso rather than bad filter coffee - room service burger was â‚¬20 and was clearly very processed meat plus some soggy fries - check-out took nearly 15 minutes - rooms and public areas (apart from reception) are very tired - water pressure was almost too poor to have a shower over the bath At very best, a 4* hotel. Would be OK at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “just too expencive”
Reviews.Author: janneman10
Reviews.Content: room is good, beds are very comfy, but it is not special when i think about it after paying almost 300 euro for one night, breakfast for two and parking at the hotel. parking is not a problem in the area by the way. this place of amsterdam is also nice and you feel safe outside but 230 euro just for a room is to much i had an upgraded room, but i could here my neighbours talking to each other (there was a closed door between the rooms) also the jaccuzy is not special (save the money for this) breakfast is also expencive and not as good as i hoped for many times we had better breakfast ! we had a good time but next time i take another hotel and save some money city center is 20 minutes walking

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not 5*”
Reviews.Author: inga07
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but I would have expected more from a 5*. Have stayed in nice 4* ones. Towels and sheets were old, there was even a hole in the sheets! Carpets in halls and elevators were dirty. Otherwise nice lobby and good restaurant, friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: AtkinsonsinAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: My five month old son, two dogs (can't leave dogs in the room if you're not there), husband, and I stayed in this hotel for almost two weeks while waiting our apartment to be ready. The porters were incredibly helpful, room service and staff at the bar were fabulous, the front desk was hit or miss. Some of the staff went above and beyond (found us daytime quarters for our dogs, gave us suggestions on where to eat/live/visit/etc). Some of the staff told us they were too busy to fax documents for us, turned their nose up at an unusual request, etc. We figured out quickly who to ask for help and stayed away from the other staff. Housekeeping was fabulous--always had a green apple and turn down ready for us at 7PM. Everything was a little expensive but the room service was yummy, the service was pleasant, and it was located in a lovely neighborhood. The only downside (which for my needs was a very large downside) was that the internet was down for quite a few days and when it came back up, we had a very slow poor connection. I would highly recommend this hotel to any businessperson. In response to those saying the rooms weren't very large--I found them to be quite large. We came with 10 bags and a ton of baby gear but still had quite a bit of room left for ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed --- Not a 5-star hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: pgreenld
Reviews.Content: The Bilderberg Garden Hotel is located in a lovely neighborhood to the south of central Amsterdam, within a 10 minute walk of the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum. It is a pleasant location with lots of greenery, set among beautiful houses, lovely shops nearby, and canals to explore. The hotelâ€™s brochures and website information describe the area of the hotel quite accurately. However, it is over-rated as a 5-star hotel and over-priced. Most of the rooms look like a typical 3-star hotel would look in the US with similarly modest furnishings. The room we stayed in was rather worn-out and needed updating, carpet-cleaning, etc. Staff at the desk were polite but not well-informed and not especially helpful. There is a rather spartan â€œBusiness Centerâ€� consisting of 2 computers and a printer in the hallway of the lower level of the hotel. There is no Fitness Center or pool. Several guidebooks described this hotel as a top-level hotel with beautiful furnishings, etc. Maybe this is true of selected rooms, but it seems that most rooms are not like this at all. Beware â€“ guidebooks say that rooms have Jacuzzis. This is not the case for the average room here. One guidebook called the Lobby â€œspectacular.â€� We thought it was rather small and darkly lit --- not very inviting at all. We felt ripped off by the high prices of this place and left after 2 nights to move to a real 5-star hotel in the center of Amsterdam. We are not sure why the guidebooks have gone so far wrong on this place. Unless you stay in the very top-level rooms, you will not find this to be a 5-star hotel. If you want a quiet and pleasant suburban location, walking distance to the big museums, and a rather unspectacular and somewhat over-priced hotel, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel? Or an office block?”
Reviews.Author: RobBurberry
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for somewhere which LOOKS swanky from the exterior, then this is not the hotel for you. Located 10 minutes taxi ride from the centre of the city, the BiIderberg Garden Hotel looks like an office block from the outside. But to be fair, this is perhaps the harshest criticism to be levelled at this hotel. Although it can feel slightly claustrophic due to it's low ceilings, it does in fact have attentive staff, and a better than average restaurant. The rooms look a little tired, but all in all, this is a good hotel if you want to stay somewhere slightly quieter in this city. It's a just a shame it doesn't look like a hotel, but more like an office.

Reviews.Title: “what a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lucy321
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive room on the third floor which was very large for Europe and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Our stay was for a Sunday night only with a late Monday checkout. The restaurant was closed so ate in the bar/lounge from their limited menu and we enjoyed our meal. This hotel is not located in the tourist centre which we found a blessing as it's situated in a quiet, pleasant neighbourhood. It is about a 30 min walk or a short tram ride into the busy, noisy part of town. We walked in to town both days and trammed it "home" once. Each day, on arrival back to the hotel, we felt we'd arrived back to the sane part of town! Reception staff very helpful and friendly staff in bar/lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Standards have slipped”
Reviews.Author: anawhatatraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel for several years now while visiting Amsterdam on business. I find the location is great - a nice neighbourhood if you want to be a little out of the centre but close to classical music, museums and nice shops. Unfortunately I really noticed a slip in standards during my last visit. My room had no working air conditioning and was positioned next to the lift well - very noisy. While I was moved it was only after considerable effort on my part and with little evidence of the friendly and helpful service I have experienced in the past. I have to say also that the renovations that have been undertaken seem like a bit of a step backwards from what used to be offered.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, more for business”
Reviews.Author: SND138
Reviews.Content: Stayed there by accident, as I booked at the Bilderberg's other Amsterdam property (better location), but, because I am an idiot, I mistakenly booked starting the day before and they had given up our room. Completely my mistake and they quickly found us a room at the Garden and paid for a cab to get us there... I stayed on the "Executive Level" (third floor - room 1403) which had its own elevator and everything, so I'm not sure if my perception applies to all rooms... Room was solid and, by European standards, pretty sizable. Comfortable bed and very clean and well-appointed.. Staff was helpful enough... Two minor complaints... The breakfast is outrageously overpriced - 21 Euros for what many hotels offer for free... Then, the location was pretty poor for anything to do with the city center. We rented bikes and were fine, and I appreciated being so close to Vondelpark, but if you're on vacation I'd look for the other Bilderberg location...

Reviews.Title: “Far from the core, but lovely safe area!”
Reviews.Author: Bukwaas
Reviews.Content: You can always take the trams to the core. Very safe area to roam around. A bit isolated (as you're literally in the 'suburbs'), though. Fantastic breakfast buffet, one of the best on our entire 3 week European trip.

Reviews.Title: “Business only”
Reviews.Author: Paulklib
Reviews.Content: I stay frequently at this hotel, not by enthusiasm but because it is the one selected by my company. Lobby/lounge area is fine; too short menu at the bar, but food is decent. Very kind reception staff. Once you move to the rooms, it becomes another story. Rooms are tiny except "executive" rooms; doors are of the noisy "slam" type, and sound insulation is poor. Sometimes they seem to have some difficulty starting breakfast service at 7 am. As a whole, definitively not up to the claimed 5 stars, but a correct business hotel if you need be in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VLA84
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the end of January 2008 and it was simply fantastic. Other reviews have commented on how this hotel is slightly outside the main city centre but to my mind this is not a bad thing. 1. It is only 15-20 minute walk into the centre of town and it's a wonderful way to explore the city and escape the traditional tourist path. 2. The trams in Amsterdam are v. easy to use and reliable and it is only a 10 minute ride into the centre. 3. If you want to get a taxi back after an evening out it is only about $12. We booked one of the excutive suites on the top floor which are spacious and well appointed with a jacuzzi. Lastly the staff could not do enough for you; always going that extra mile. We will definatley be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in tranquil area off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: treehug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Year and paid extortionate rates as we went last minute. 320 Euros a night... having said that the hotel was lovely, but nothing spectacular. It is a modern 70's building opposite the Hilton, in a residential area filled with beautiful Amsterdam School influenced houses. We found it easy to get a tram 5 or 24 into Leidesplein, and you are a 10 minute walk to the park and Museumplein. I have never stayed in this part of Amsterdam before and was really surprised. It is tranquil, green and has some lovely shops and bakeries a few streets walk. Hire a bike from the hotel and explore the area - Do not get ripped off with the taxis though - we paid 25 Euros to get there from CS and it should be nearer 10!! The hotel itself is comfortable, not overly luxurious though. The emphasis is on understated design, and tones are all browns and greys. The staff were welcoming and helpful - and the breakfast staff were always cheery - which was great with a hangover. We stayed in an executive double on the third floor (1406). You get an exclusive lift and the room had a large semi circular floor to ceiling window overlooking a main road. I imagine in non holiday times this would be noisy, but the light in the room was pleasant. The bed was huge and very comfortable, and there was plenty of storage and extra seating. The bathroom, although large and marble designed lacked the wow factor - the jacuzzi bath was tired and the shower was in the wrong place - plus the water pressure, presumably from high occupancy was a bit iffy too. Breakfast wasn't included in the room charge and is 21 Euros, or if you order it when you check in, 15 Euros. I grumbled a bit, but the breakfast is fabulous and worth the money. Better than any spread I have seen since the Westin in Rotterdam. I don't have any complaints that would deter me from recommending this hotel - at the right price. It doesn't feel like a 5 star though- the opulence isn't evident, and there were niggling charges - 10 Euros to use the WiFi which should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel a Little Far Out”
Reviews.Author: TonyDean
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are amazing, the rooms are a step above the average, and the property well maintained. Need an umbrella? The front desk has those. There's no need to pack one. Need directions? Just ask at the desk, they know the way. Want something to eat? There are plenty of great local restaurants a short tram ride away. The neighborhood is completely 100% safe and quiet. The hotel is a short 2.5 blocks from the Apollolan tram stop. Cabs seem to be always at the ready during normal hours.... Also - kudos to the housekeeping staff. We were very late in leaving our room on some days and the staff always had the room ready when we returned. Turn down service was prompt and efficient. The rooms were spotless. This is the type of property to book if you don't want to stay in the loud and rowdy downtown area. I honestly don't know how anyone gets any sleep in some of the properties downtown. That isn't a problem here. The proximity to the Apollolan tram stop means you can be at the museum district in 5 minutes after boarding a tram, downtown in 10 minutes. Remember that trams stop running at 12:30 at night, so budget a 20 Euro Cab Ride and you'll make it back fine. Tell the cabbie "Apollolan Tram Stop" and they'll get you there. Finally, if flying out early in the morning inform the front desk and they'll have a cab for you. The price is $33 euros to be taken directly to the airport - a bargain when you're in a rush. Plan to leave for the airport 2-2.5 hours before your flight. It's a 15 minute drive. As for the room decor - somewhat chic. The pillows were too soft and large for my taste, but very nice nonetheless. Also, if you want two beds you might need to rearrange the furniture as the room we stayed in had two twins that were pushed together to make a king. We moved the nightstand, seperated the beds by putting a nightstand between them, and everything worked out. I am certain the hotel would have done so if we had asked. This was one instance where it was easier to do it ourself and much faster than calling for assistance. I do this often in foreign countries and it seems to work fine everytime.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramblingman77
Reviews.Content: 4 star hotel. Okay I was little bothered when I pulled up due to the building not giving me impression of 4 star. The staff made the differance, and were beyond professional. It was obvious after staying here that the hotel had a reputation, and the clientel were upper crust. Me being american am used to smoking outside and did so here. Smoking is still allowed in the hotel, and every time I went out someone from the hotel was soon out to see what I was doing. So security was good there. They had parking, and was reasonbable. It was street parking. I did not opt for internet and cannot comment, but it was time pay. Room was grat and extremely comfortable. Hotel places green apples throughout the hotel, and I soon learned to love these and would grab one from time to time. Location is in an affluent area of town with local eating and shopping. Not real close to touristy part of Amsterdam but tram was close. I actually enjoyed the distance at this hotel as area was maybe 10 minutes away, and points in between were of interest and I might have missed otherwise. If you want to feel quality stay here. This hotel gave me a breathe of fresh air after one month in "charming" hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and nice”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler1204
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel for 4 nights on business. Overall, it was very clean and comfortable. The decor was modern and the furnishings seemed pretty new. I'm a stickler for cleanliness and felt good about this place. It was a very functional hotel for the business traveler. The staff was nice and helpful enough when I had questions or concerns. For example, my room was a bit chilly and they made sure to have a portable heater set up in my room by the time I returned in the evening. The hotel is located in a quieter part of the city so it may not be as convenient for the tourist looking to stay in the heart of amsterdam...however, it is close to some good museums and it's maybe a 10-15 minute tram ride to the city center. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a comfortable, pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “fanstastic stay”
Reviews.Author: toots68
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay 3 nights in this wonderful hotel in August. It was a little further out of the centre than we expected but in easy reach of tram stops in 2 directions, one of which was over a bridge and a lovely 5 minute stroll alongside a beautiful canal lined with extremely grand houses (where I would love to live if lucky enough to win the lottery and buy property in Amsterdam). The distance in some ways was a good thing, you could get away from the bustle of the centre and see a part of Amsterdam you would never visit, a small village type area was a few minutes away with lovely shops and busy restaurants full of Amsterdams rich people, also an organic deli (Van Dams)and some wonderful shops for window shopping or maxing out the credit card. Check in was fast efficient and friendly and we upgraded to a room on the executive floor for 30 extra euros a night, we were extremely pleased with our room which had a huge bed with heaps of quality cushions and crisp linen which was changed daily and if you were out in the evening the bed was remade, pillows fluffed and a crisp green apple left on a black napkin next to each side of the bed. The jaquzzi bath was most welcome after a day of sight seeing and the option of a power shower to freshen up too. We had a wonderful bay window with tub chairs overlooking amazing rooftops of probably one of the most expensive areas in Amsterdam. Breakfast was great, so much choice given, and we were lucky enough to have this included in the room price when booking with thomson. We ate enough to skip lunch ! Reception were so helpful and well informed, we got our Van Gogh tickets straight from them and it allowed us to skip a hugh queue at the museum leaving many poor people behind us standing in the rain, would definately recommend getting pre paid tickets. You can also borrow lovely umbrellas from reception if you are unlucky enough to have rain. My only quibble would be the fact we had no opening windows, air conditioning which you could adjust was great, but after a few days I just felt the need for 'real' fresh air All in all a wonderful stay in a fabulous hotel, which feels luxurious and relaxed without being at all stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: David_Rolon
Reviews.Content: While planning a two week trip to Spain, I kept coming across the best airfare deals connecting through Amsterdam. Having never been to Ams. before, we thought we might take advantage of the cheap airfare and add a few extra days to our trip and visit there. After completing our airfare purchase, we went on Hotwire to find a hotel. As we all know, Hotwire doesn't display the Hotel name until after you complete your purchase, so there's always that element of a crapshoot as you push the go button. Went ahead with the purchase, which was in the $150/night range. Sure enough, up came the confirmation that we were booked in the Bilderberg Garden. I immediately came to Trip Advisor to see what I had gotten myself into. After reading a few negative reviews regarding the location, I thought the hotel was located in Timbuktu and that I had made a big mistake. Let me set you straight. Unless you are a college student or twenty-something looking for endless partying, why would you want to stay in the middle of a busy street with thousands of tourists streaming by night and day. The Bilderberg Garden is located in one of the most posh neighborhoods on Earth. The homes along the 2 block stretch (all 8 of them) to the tram station are some of the most amazing homes I've ever seen. Talk about elegant. There are two tram stations, each about 5 minutes walk away and it's two stops to the museum district, another two or three to leidseplein, a few more to Dam Square and a few more to Centraal Station. All told you can get wherever you want to go in 20 minutes or less, with plenty of interesting things to view along the way. The Hilton hotel is across the street and there is the Best Western Delphi down the block and at least one other small boutique hotel on the same block. I honestly feel the location is one of the major plusses of this hotel. It's safe and quiet at night, easy to get to and from and quite elegant in a understated, European way. Every inch of the hotel is absolutely spotless. The rooms are beautiful and the bathrooms are all marble with high-tech European fixtures. The staff was extremely helpful and took as much time as needed to help us with directions, recommendations and answers to our many questions. We were made to feel welcomed and everyone went out of their way to make sure all of our needs were met. Many of the positive attributes stated here are consistent with Amsterdam in general, such as safety and cleanliness, however, we could not find a single thing wrong with this hotel. It's sad how a few bad reviews can really cause a person to look elsewhere, but we feel lucky that we had an opportunity to stay in such a well-run establishment and would most definitely do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but with exceptions”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel50
Reviews.Content: Booked over Expedia and expected the executive room as per the picture, but got a deluxe style room on the executive floor, so felt this was misleading. However, for the price per night, the accomodation was great and the hotel is near a tramline so no problem getting around, despite being out of the city centre. We were supposed to have a non-smoking room, and when we got there it stank of smoke, despite the receptionist assuring us it was a non-smoking room. Also had extra stuff added to the bill, but it was removed without question when I queried it. Staff all very polite and helpful and the rooms were clean, with a turndown service and apples placed in the room each evening - but the quality of the toiletries was a very big disappointment, would expect better from a 5 star hotel. Overall, happy because of the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a bit far from city centre...”
Reviews.Author: duttzi
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, but a bit far from the city centre (but not a big problem because of the easy tram connection). The room we got was right next to the lobby entrance and there was some noise because of this. Good beds and nice room. All in all a nice hotel, but overrated (5 stars?).

Reviews.Title: “Great Bilderberg”
Reviews.Author: Vic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Bilderberg Garden Hotel for three nights in September and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is not near the centre of Amsterdam but this suited us just fine. We were looking for a quiet getaway after a hectic few weeks. The hotel is a big brick building and very out of place in the very stylish surrounding area. However the inside is modern and stylish. We had an exectuive room which was clean, well kept and add all the extra ammenities you expect from a good hotel. It is only a 10 minute walk to the museum area of Amsterdam and there are lots of lovely restaurants on the way there. The Solo restaurant was just gorgeous. We only used public transport on our journey back to Schipol the rest of the time we walked everywhere as the weather was so gorgeous. We walked to the Anne Frank house, Dam Square and the Red Light district amongst other places. If you are looking for to be in the centre of the Amsterdam then this wont be the place for you but if you want a well run hotel in a quiet location, then the Bilderberg will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: Tendons
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a last minute deal to this hotel, and had a great time. The hotel is located next to the Hilton, in a quiet residential area that's about 20 minutes from the centre of town by tram. That was a bit of a surprise initially, but having said that, the area is absolutely wonderful. The local cafes are great, everyone is very friendly, and the atmosphere is much more relaxing than the centre of town. You can also walk to Vondelpark, and there are loads of posh shops if you want to spend some serious cash. The hotel does look like a concrete box from the outside, and is quite incongruous considering the architecture in the vicinity. Its internal design is very contemporary, and the staff were extremely helpful. Our room wasn't available on arrival, so we were given a free upgrade to a suite for the night (a nice touch of luxury!). Our executive room was very typical of executive rooms everywhere - standard room size with upgrades like a spa bath, tv, internet, etc. I couldn't fault it. We didn't take breakfast, but dinner was delicious and again the staff were very attentive. Having travelled extensively, I've come to the conclusion that a good 5 star hotel might have the occasional problem, but the attitude of the staff to these problems defines its star rating. I think the Bilderberg definitely deserves its 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: Lou78
Reviews.Content: I always leave reviews as my husband and I travel a lot and I always use trip advisor to help me make my decisions on where we should stay. This time as we were planning on staying in Holland for a week travelling from one city to another starting with 3 nights in Amsterdam. We decided the cost was important and while we needed to read up on the reviews we also need a good deal otherwise our week away would get very costly very quickly. Big mistake I would rather have paid another Â£75 a night than have saved money to stay here and this is why:- Very remote location in a posh suburban area. We knew it was a bit out of town but did not realise it would be a 20 â€“ 25 min tram ride from the centre. The hotel itself looks like a 1960â€™s concrete multi storey car park from the outside but I was kind of expecting it to look a bit grim after reading reviews on here. Our first sight as we turned the corner was of a huge group on staff on a fag break â€“ nice! Check in took 25 mins. There was no one else in the queue the girl just kept being interrupted and tried to give us a smoking room, it then took her ages to find a non smoking room. We finally got our room card key and found our room on the first floor. It was dark, so dark you had to switch the lights on to see. I am all for a bit of green but the trees outside out window completely obscured any natural light. As we were there for 3 nights we decided to ask to change rooms. Room number two was better but the road was quite loud and the window did not shut. Not just slightly open it was open quite a way it was clearly broken and would not shut. By now 1 hr and 15 min had passed and we were a bit annoyed. We were then told there were no other non smoking rooms other than an upgrade to an Executive room BUT we could only have it for one night and then we would have to move â€“ again! By now we were really tired and just wanted to get on with our holiday and agreed. The Executive room was hardly executive the room was basically the same as a standard room (ours was in fact smaller than the previous two rooms); the same bath only with a jacuzzi setting and better quality bed linen! However the room was an improvement on the last two as it had replacement windows that opened and closed and it was not dark. The next morning after a very average breakfast (hair in your fruit salad anyone?) we went to the desk to ask if we could stay in our room as we really did not think it was fair to move us again! An hour later we were told after much debate that no we could not stay there and we had the choice of one of two rooms that we had to wait until after 11am to see. More wasted time of our precious holiday. We chose the room, were told our stuff would be moved and went out for our day (just before lunch!) On retuning to our new room we were gob smacked to find that the room was full of cigarette smoke and I am not joking you could see it in the air! Where was it coming from? The air conditioning unit of course! After another 45 mins we were moved to another room that luckily for us did not stink of smoke. The manager said she did not know why the room was full of smoke and would have to get it seen to as other guests were checking in shortly (luckily them!) We were offered a free drink for having to change rooms 5 times which we felt was the least they could do. You go on holiday to relax and make the most of your time and we wasted hours trying to deal with very incompetent staff to find a room that was not full of smoke, really dark and had a window that shut (surely not to much to ask from a 5 star (hilarious!) hotel. On our last morning after another delicious breakfast! we came back to our room to pack to find smoke pouring out of the air con unit! We were dumbfounded and just packed as quickly as we could and left. We were asked if we had enjoyed our stay during check out and I couldnâ€™t speak as I did not know what to stay. We love Amsterdam, we had wonderful weather, we fell in love all over again with the parks, canals, friendly people, laid back attitude and the great museums but the Bilderberg Garden was a horrific experience that will never be repeated and I would urge others to think again before booking this hotel. The hotel has had a very cheap makeover and has lots of issues that need addressing. Whoever gave this hotel 5 stars from the tourist board was having a very off day indeed! We stayed at the Radisson in Amsterdam on Rusland during our last visit which was amazing. Yes it cost more but it was worth it and it is where we will be staying next time we go to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient”
Reviews.Author: DrillCat
Reviews.Content: Well, I booked this hotel after reading all the reviews here. The first leg of my family's18 day trip to europe was in Amsterdam (We stayed at Rokin APT) and this was our last leg of our travel before returing home. I have sorta mixed feel about this hotel. I booked 2 rooms adjoining together since we were a family of 4. My wife, 2 young boys and I. The service was fast, efficient and great. They didn't have any problem with early check ins and tried to accommodate whatever we' had needed upon check in. However, I thought the place was a bit odd to derserve 5 star ratings. The rooms were richly decorated and were modern enough. However, the building itself didn't have the normal 5 star hotel feel to it. It was more like a semi luxury country inn with 4 star rating. There aren't anything around the hotel since it's located in a very nice residential neighborhood. The tram stop was a good 15 minute walk. It took us about 20 minutes to the main part of the town. I saw a Maybach(a $300,000 mecedes) parked in one of the houses near the hotel. If you do not mind being away from the happening places, go right ahead since it will be cheaper and cleaner, but if you want some action till late night, go stay near the dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RamblerUK_Kent
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The location was perfect being a 20 mins walk away from the main square, situated in a leafy and quiet neighbourhood. Checking in at the hotel was quick and painless, we had booked our room through lastminute.com and just had to pay an extra charge for the city tax. We drove over and they also sorted out the parking fee so we could then drop our bags off and get straight out and tour the town. The room was clean and comfortable and the beds were perfect. Its a shame we were only there for 1 night, but we will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: The Bilderberg Garden hotel is a nice cosy hotel in one of the best parts of Amsterdam; Oud-Zuid. Check-in is fine, staff is friendly and gives you the correct information about things to do, public transportation etc. The rooms are large and nice decorated, they are extremely clean and offer good climatcontrol. The rooms are equipt with a average bed, two chairs and a working desk. The lightening in the rooms is very good. The bathroom is average but offers sometimes a whirpooll which is of course very very nice! The food from the roomservice is fresh and ok. Big plus is the location, not in the absolute citycenter but located in a very green and friendly part of Amsterdam. A tramline, (line 5) at 3 minutes walking offers you a direct connection to the Leidseplein, Van Goghmuseum and Citycenter in less then 10 minutes. Overall; nice and great place to stay with reasonable pricing, you're absolutely not feeling ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good resuraunt, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Lucan16
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. It was not in the centre but it was very easy to get a tram, taxi or walk to the town. Being a little way out mean't we saw other areas on the way in, it was never a problem and the hotel is situated in a nice, quite residential area. The staff were very helpful, checked if our room was ready even though we were early, allowed us to check in early, responded to any request and provided us with local information and a map. The room was comfortable and clean and the apples left by the bed is a nice touch. Everyone speaks English without any sign of it being an annoyance. The food in the resturaunt was the best I've had for years although the service was a little slow. Breakfast is expensive but very nice. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: wannago
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable 2 night stay here - slightly marred by the slow check in process and the way they nickle & dime you for every service. We arrived too early to check in, but they very obligingly stored our luggage and gave us a map with some helpful advice and a loaner umbrella. I completed (I thought) the check in paperwork and we went exploring. When we returned to offically check in the deck clerk was overwhelmed - it took 30 minutes for her to finish processing our check in, and still one of the room keys did not work. Seriously, she answered the phone 7 times while "waiting" on me. I almost went Russel Crowe and ripped it out of her hands. That done, the room was very nice; quiet and very comfortable. The air conditioning was adequate, but a little warm even on the coldest setting. Bathroom was good size and the toiletries were Crabtree & Evelyn, generously replenished each day. I had pre ordered the fruit plate for us - BIG MISTAKE. It amounted to 2 apples and a dull knife. They have apples at all the elevater landings and lobby for free. Then there is a charge for connecting to the internet daily or hourly - if you use their business center there is a charge by the minute and charge per page for printing. I've not run into that before, and since it is handy to print boarding passes, I was peeved. We loved the location, pretty boulevard and easy walk to beautiful Vondell park. The museums were an easy walk, as was the buss. We did not use the hotel dining room, the menu did not appeal to us, but we had an excellant although expensive dinner at the Hilton next door. I would recommend this hotel and the lovely location, just be forewarned if you need internet access, and don't buy their extras.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: NDWHoustonTX
Reviews.Content: We chose the Bilderberg Garden Hotel because of favorable reviews, and we were delighted to find the hotel just as described, with very clean, modern rooms and baths. We opened our windows to the brisk evening breezes and slept like babies on comfy beds fitted with crisp white linens. The location, in a lovely, quiet neighborhood of wide, tree-lined streets with easy access to Amsterdam's excellent tram system, is terrific. The youthful, good-looking staff could not have been more professional or more helpful. Don't miss the on-site restaurant -- the food is fresh, inventive, and delicious, and the wait staff is friendly and solicitous.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay !”
Reviews.Author: ShariWestSussex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of May. The hotel is on the outskirts of Amsterdam in a quiet leafy street (adjacent to the Hilton). The room was large and was decorated in classic neutral colours.There was no chest of drawers but one was brought to us within ten minutes of asking ,along with extra hangers.If you like to use a powerful hairdryer then bring your own.They have a turn down service in the evening where they leave an apple on the bedside.Tea and coffee makeing facilities are provided although there is only powdered coffee creamer.The safe is large enough to take a lap top and wi fi is available in the rooms.There are also two computers in the basement for guest use.Everywhere is spotless. We had a meal in the restaurant and although expensive 88 euros (no wine three courses ) the food and service were excellent. It is the staff that make this Hotel so exceptional as at all levels they are friendly, helpful and courteous.They will recommend places to go, arrange tickets etc There was a charge on our bill for doing this but it was quickly removed. Get the hotel shuttle from the airport (buy the tickets from the connexxions desk in the arrivals lounge 19 euros return)These are 8 seater minibuses and take only 15 to 20 minutes to the hotel. Go left out of the hotel and then right over the bridge and this brings you to an area for shops, newspapers, cafes restaurants and a superbly stocked organic supermarket.Broms the hardware store sells tram ticket strips (15 for 6.80, most trips use two strips). Van Dams is great for Breakfast 3.00 for a large bowl of fresh fruit, yogourt and granola 5.50 for a bagel with salmon and cream cheese.Everything is fresh. La Joffiers across the road is more expensive and not such good quality. Palma is an authentic Italian restaurant (no pizzas) which is first class. this is a lovely area for a relaxed holiday and the centre of Amsterdam is only 10 minutes away( catch the number 2 from the stop just past Van Dams or turn left out of the hotel go to the end of the road turn right and catch the 5 or 24 at the Appollaan stop)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsmith2837
Reviews.Content: What a simply wonderful hotel in Amsterdam. The rooms are very modern, very clean and very roomy. A two block walk takes you to the tram and then you are just a few stops away from anywhere in the City. However, what sets this hotel apart from its peers is the staff. To a person, they were all very warm, friendly and extremely helpful. They anticipated every need and answered our typical tourist questions with great skill and very high customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Western View
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in South Amsterdam, across the street from the Hilton. It is in a wonderful neighborhood with excellent wine shops, bakeries, florists, restaurants and other shops. Although it is a 15-20 minute walk to the museums, it is through Vondel Park...wonderful park to walk each morning. If you prefer to stay in a great neighborhood, away from the noise and congestion....this is the place for you. The rooms were good value and contemporary. The staff was exceptional...they did everything they could to help with directions, rental cars, advise, etc. The breakfast buffet was good. Not as good as say the The Pulitzer...but good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bilderberg!”
Reviews.Author: hobbes2172
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a weekend getaway in Amsterdam and absolutely loved it. The service at the hotel was fantastic. They had made a mistake with our original reservation and we were upgraded to a superior room. The room was spacious with a large window overlooking the street. The hotel itself has a very 1970s feel from the outside, but it is clean and fresh on the interior. The bathroom was large with an excellent shower and tub. The bed was huge and comfy. The hotel staff were very helpful at all times during our visit. The hotel is ideally located away from the bustle of the main drag but not too far to be inconvenient. The hotel is located less than a five minute walk to the tram (#5 or #24) which takes you into the centre of town. Loved it! Definitely would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkgin34
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed for 3 nights. the hotel is lovely and clean. our room was fab, the bathroom squeaky clean. staff were really helpful and friendly. buy your tickets for van gogh museum at the hotel to avoid queues, same price and you walk straight in. just found out you can buy the anne frank tickets online and go straight in. the queues are really long all day, waiting 2 hours plus !!!!! the area by the hotel is beautiful, only 10 min walk to museum quarter. great restaurant nearby, turn left out of hotel doors and right, over bridge straight down to shops and it is on the right. pasta and pizza, called sardegna. really reasonable and lovely food. watch out for the bikes in amsterdam!!!!! we bought a 2 day tram ticket from hotel for 10 euros 50 each. you can hop on anywhere. we had breakfast one morning in hotel, order the night before as it is 15 euros instead of 21. have a fab time and dont mix space cake and alcohol as husband went a bit silly after mixing both, i had to escort him out of shop with novelty salt and peppers in rude shapes !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: drumaloor
Reviews.Content: Just back from three nights in Bilderberg Gardern Hotel. Its a very nice hotel. We did not have breakfast and didnt eat there so cant comment on the food.The staff were excellent and very friendly and really helped us with tram advise and gave us a street map. The rooms are very clean, bed luxurious. It is in a quiet location, however this may suit some people. it only takes 15mins on number 5 or 24 tram to get to the centre, trams run regularly until 12.30 at night, after that the bus service which is slow and can be infrequent. Overall very happy, Amsterdam very nice city, people are very friendly, lots of nice restaurants to choose from. Would go back to Amsterdam. Highly recommended, its beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best Hotel we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: LNoble2310
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this Hotel I am extremely fussy, but I just couldn't fault anything about this Hotel - the rooms were very clean - white bed linen was gorgeous. The breakfast was superb, the staff were amazing - couldn't do enough to help. Although the location of the Hotel is 30 minutes (perhaps a little more) walk from the centre, it's not far from Museum Square and is very quiet. We thought there was no-one else staying in the Hotel! I would love to go back and stay in this Hotel. Fabulous place! Linda & Michael Noble

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Leafy Suburb”
Reviews.Author: Gillbtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bildberg Garden Hotel the last weekend November, 2006. We had a great time hotel very clean, the room was smashing lots of hot water. Well stocked mini bar, english speaking channels on tv. The hotel was in a very upmarket suburb of Amsterdam about fifteen minutes on the tram. the tram stop was abouit five mins walk away. think it was tram twenty four which runs very regularly to the centre. We found a very nice Italian restaurant which we ate in in the evening. Didnt go back into the city decided to eat locally too tired after being out all day sightseeing. Went to the Cinema one afternnon by Rembrantsplein to watch Casino Royale, enjoyed this very much. Love Amsterdam this was our third visit in three years. Would recommend the hotel, althought not central very easy to get to other places in amsterdam Museumplein etc. Overall a smashing time was had . Will no doubt be returning to Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tates
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel an I was a bit apprehensive as I had read some bad reviews on trip advisor. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is not the most beautiful from outside, but never judge a book by its cover. The staff at the front desk were helpful, courteous and efficient. The hotel foyer is lovely and the room we stayed in was very nice, lovely bathroom and very comfortable bed. Although we did not eat at the hotel the menu sounded delicous and they had a very good snack menu in their bar. Overall I think the hotel is lovely set in a residental area, which was nice to come back to after the noise of the centre of amsterdam. The tram stop is just round the corner and a number 5 will take you past all the sights and straight to the central station. All in all we had a great trip and the hotel was great value for money. Tip: buy a tram ticket from the reception of the hotel. They area for different lengths depending on your stay. Good value for a 3 day ticket, 13 euros.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gibsonlittle
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay in Amsterdam and before our departure I was a little apprehensive about this hotel, having read the very mixed reviews on this site. However my concerns were completely unfounded - the hotel staff were most helpful and all requests were dealt with promptly and courteously. We were provided with a great map and given good advice about places to visit. The breakfast was in our opinion good value as after eating it you really didn't need another meal until the evening. Our room was comfortable and had all the necessary facilities. The hotel is only a short tram ride from the centre and all the major tourist attractions and I would definitely recommend it to friends visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel near tram line”
Reviews.Author: troybadoo
Reviews.Content: We thought for the price we payed, it would be close to immpossible to top this quality in Amsterdam. Although it isnt centrally located it is very close to a tram stop and you are at Liedsplein in less than 10 mins. The breakfasts were amazing, the staff were the best we have encountered for a long time. The style and decor of the hotel and rooms were modern, bright and fresh. The room although basic had everything we needed. Attention to detail was excellent. If we went to Amsterdam again which we are sure to do, we wouldnt hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “no attitude here”
Reviews.Author: montyandco
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and you always worry. Im from London and dont like to be let down and we honestly were not. We went pre rebuild as such and we had no problems there. Staff nice polite and very helpful, restaurant was easy to book and staff again were very informative, the cuisine was exceptional, the waiters more than willing to help if you were not sure what to order. the surrounding area is lovely, quiet and very well kept. We never once caught the tram and only got a taxi once and we were in and around the square everyday at some stage. We walked everywhere and if it was not for the location we would never had seen so much of Amsterdam. It is approx 20 mins to the square in all directions, we walked a different way everyday which in my opinion is the only way to see everything in Amsterdam, I could not imagine staying in the Square. Dont forget that Amsterdam is similar to London, Paris, Milan etc, if you want to spend money you certainly can, The hotel sells some very expensive food, wine and fine cigars, they also sell some very good Heineken, lovely cheap white wine and standard cigars. More importantly they dont look down or upto you regardless of what you spend or how much you tip. If you are concerned about the American ladies review about the taxi drivers, book them from the hotel, they are cheaper, especially the drive back to the airport. Just book the hotel, we cant wait to go back. Monty.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, not really for tourists”
Reviews.Author: equitytrading
Reviews.Content: OK, 1. Hotel is not near anything really. I am not sure why on the map and in reviews and on the website it says it's close to the musuems. I mean its not FAR, but it's not across the street either. 2. Since trains shut off at midnight, and you're not going to walk here from the main attractions/ nightlife, you are forced to take a cab. The cabbies are actually quite scary. One of them was so sexually offensive to us (to put it incredibly mildly) that we made him pull over and got out asap, after he grabbed 20 euros out of our hands of course, and I left my bag in the cab with 500$ worth of stuff (glasses, etc.). 3. These same sketchy cabbies will drive you around Amsterdam for a while running up the meter because they are so desperate for money. In the case of the very scary situation above, we probably would've at taken the cab to the hotel IF he hadn't been driving us in the OPPOSITE DIRECTION. I mean honestly, I felt we were going to some warehouse to have our kidneys removed. It was terrifying (once again, putting it mildly). 4. The restaurant, um, sucked. I'm from Manhattan and after reading the reviews expected something exceptional. The creme brulee was disgusting. The appetizer of venicen and cod was dilicious. the entree of sea bass was bland. For 40 euro, go someplace else, like THE GARAGE or BARK, both of which were booked all night when we tried to walk in off the street. These places are right near the hotel and open till midnight. The hotel told us everyplace closes at 10 except Bark. They should've told us about the GARAGE also (both places were really bustling and fancy) and made us a reservation or something but they didn't. Oh well. 5. The exterior or the hotel will not impress you. DO NOT expect a five star experience. Like the review below, maybe 3 stars. Overall, if you're a tourist, stay someplase else. You want to be able to pop into the hotel mid-day to freshen up, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms in a quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Valleygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bilderberg Garden for three nights in the week before Christmas. The total cost was â‚¬500 and we stayed in an executive room. The room was lovely, really clean and large, with modern furnishings and a huge bed, TV with many stations in english, CD player and seating area. Each evening a lady left us an apple each. The first night, the room was really hot and we couldn't get the air conditioning to work properly, but we mentioned it to the receptionist the next morning and when we returned in the evening it had been fixed. During the evening a staff member came to check that it was OK and brought us a card apologising for the inconvenience, and a box of chocolates, which was a pleasant surprise. Although we did not eat in the hotel restaurant, the menu was modern and not unreasonable for a special night at â‚¬39 for three courses. Many of the guests were obviously business people but we did not feel out of place, and the receptionist gave us a very helpful map and showed us the best places to go. In fact, that free map was more useful than many of the maps in the guide books as it contained tram routes, canal bus routes and shopping areas all on one page. It was a five minute walk to the tram stop and there were 8 trams an hour into the city centre - about a 15 min journey. We bought a three day tram ticket from the hotel and it was hassle-free after that. The hotel itself is in a leafy suburb just off an up-market shopping street and the area was very quiet although there were restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet residential area, far from city center: not for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Dallas75204
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Bilderberg Garden Hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of a "long weekend" in Holland and Belgium. As a Dutch-tourism-rated 5 star hotel, we expected a lot, but were told later that the Dutch star ratings are based on price more than services and amenities. It is a nice hotel, but if you are expecting a "5-star experience", look elsewhere--it is not posh by any means and is probably a 3 star in all honesty. Additionally, we found the distance a little too far from the city center for our liking. The hotel is nice-enough, but does not really shine in any area nor does it endear itself to its guests. As we were driven to the front door, we were taken aback by the construction along the entire front of the hotel--it did not look inviting. (Hopefully, the construction will be finished for future guests as it was neither attractive nor especially quiet. However, upon entering we found a Dutch-modern design, with inviting fresh flower arrangements throughout. Beyond the reception is a lobby bar with a cozy fireplace. We were fortunate enough to observe the pre-Christmas flowers arrangements and the Christmas themed arrangements: mid-stay, the numerous white rose arrangements were changed to red roses, and beautiful greenery and Christmas trees were on display. Our room, as the hotel, was Dutch-modern by design: stark, with lots of dark-wood paneling and simple dark wood built-ins and small leather furniture. The bedding was sleek, but the sheets were rough to the touch. Additionally, there was a problem with the TV, as it tended to turn off or become unusable at times, and the luggage holder collapsed upon first use. There are thoughtful touches, such as shoe-shine machines on each floor, in-room coffee service with a choice of coffees and teas, and a specific style of glass/mug for each of the beers/spirits in the mini-bar. But there are negatives, such as the below-average shower and water pressure (heat equalization), no shower curtain, and smallish bathroom. The service was polite, but neither polished nor especially helpful. The hotel is located in a quiet and rather upscale residential area, but the lack of lighting on the surrounding sidewalks at night may pose a problem for some. Finally, this hotel is not convenient to any tourist areas and we noticed that it was heavily tilted towards a business clientele. The tram stop is only about a 5 minute walk away, but the additional 5 minute tram ride to the museum quarter or the 10 minute ride to the Dam area was not especially convenient and made it hard to "pop-in" to the hotel to freshen-up during the day, especially in the rain common to the region this time of year. (The hotel was represented to be "convenient" to the city center, which we definitely did not agree). In summary, this is a nice hotel, but if you are looking for an above average "upscale hotel experience", in service, amenities, quality and location, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TahoeBlue66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three days in Amsterdam at a hotel recommended to us through the site reviews here. The service was excellent, we had a very nice room (Room 401) that I would recommend because of it's view. We chose not to have breakfast here, lots of options a few blocks away. Centrally located near everything I would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, and very comfortable suite”
Reviews.Author: Nunnion
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on one of the suites, and it was very comfortable. The decoration is really nice. The staff were friendly, and helpful but it seemed a little tricky to book the attached restaurant. The location is nice and quiet, away from the bustle of central Amsterdam, but it's a bit of a trip on the tram to get to the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: ediescout
Reviews.Content: We have just came back from a few days at the Biderberg. The staff are incredibly helpful, for example I wanted and extra pillow....asked at reception and by the time I was back at my room(3-4 minutes later) the pillows were being put on my bed. I do agree the housekeeping staff are very impatient, but if you are an early bird, this should not be too much of a problem. Loved the "turn down"service...beds turned down and a snack put beside your bed in time for you returning to your room. Only negative is the extremely overpriced restaurant....ok food but oh my god, they know how to charge for it...although once again, the staff are lovely. There is a great Italian restaurant called "La Palma" nearby(as the receptionist) and she will direct you. Much cheaper and fantastic ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heracles
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Comfortable rooms and friendly personel. The hotel is situated at a beutiful area, five minutes distance from the center by tram (5 or 24). We stay 5 days and we certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and well presented. I had read a lot of the reviews on this website and was worried. The staff are very friendly and helpful but the hotel bar and room service is pricey! A few things to be aware of..... even is you place the do not disturb sign on your door the cleaners still come in and reception phone you. I accidently left some chocolates in the mini fridge which I went back for before departing as they were a present but they had been taken by the cleaners and I was told it was my fault for leaving them! The hotel is not in the heart of Amsterdam, although it is situated in a lovely area and is only a 10 minute tram ride (number 5) to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Chrix
Reviews.Content: Our party paid that little bit extra for executive rooms in this impressive hotel and we weren't disappointed. Excellent rooms and excellent service. There was work taking place within the hotel but we weren't inconvenienced at all and the friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff made our stay even more memorable. Travel tip - You could walk but the hotel is also handy for the trams into the City and it's wealth of restaurants, bars, museums and sights. Buy a 13 euro ticket at the hotel which entitles you to 72 hours travelling on the trams which are efficient, quick, frequent and clean - but watch out for the bikes when you get off!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience I have had for years - Awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: AshDG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference and was not told that they were refurbishing this hotel. It's located in South Amsterdam in a very expensive residential area. The area is ruined by the presence of this concrete "layer cake". When I went it was being refurbished - plastic sheeting over the walls and scaffolding in the interior. The restaurant was closed and there was constant drilling - made me think of a Spanish tourist resort from the 80's with the construction! My room was very 60's - brown swirly carpet, old furniture, minibar with drinks etc that were nearing expiry! The staff were very nice and I got the impression that they were doing their job well under the circumstances. The owner/management should be severely chastised for not closing down completely during the renovations - and for this reason I wonder what their opinions of dealing with customers is. The location is half an hour by crowded tram from the sights of Amsterdam - not ideal. Do not waste your time or money (or anyone elses money if someone else is paying) staying here. I travel a lot - and really and truly this place is awful! Ignore this at your peril.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the romantic special. I thought it was quiet expensive for what we got. The room was a deluxe room allthough i think the word "deluxe" is a little exagerated. I stayed in a lot of hotels all over the world i would rather call it a standard room. Ok there was a large balcony but it was to cold to use it anyway. Oh yes, don't get wild by reading the word "jacuzzi". The staff was very friendly though. The breakfeast on the room was very nice and the restaurant superb. Would I go back? Yes but in a standard room at 1/3th of the price i payed. If you don't rent a car, you have to know the hotel is not in the center. you'll have to take a (crowded) tram it'll take you 20 minutes. nevertheless we had a great time and i would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “not walking distance to attractions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel but it was not a 5* hotel as we thought it was. We also thought this was central Amsterdam but in fact it was a good 30 mins away from all the attractions Amsterdam has to offer. We thought we were staying in a executive room but were told these were under refurbishment and we should have been advised of this but we weren't which was a bit disappointing. Room was small but adequate. Thought the jacuzzi bath was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JohnGMalahide
Reviews.Content: We are an Irish couple in our early fifties and decided to celebrate our wedding anniversary in Amsterdam. After much internet searching we booked the Bilderberg Garden Hotel for three nights. We opted for the executive room option which is reached by dedicated lift.The room was on the small side but adequate. We decided to try breakfast but at 21 euro each we did not recon it good value. We felt the restaurant mangerie de kersentuin was very expensive and had a limited menu. On our final evening we booked an early wake up call at reception. It never came, luckily we had set our mobile phone alarm or we would have missed our flight. When we pointed out this to the receptionist we barely got an apology. Overall I would say yes the location is good, only a few minutes walk to appollolaan tram stop ,but this hotel is not deserving of a five star rating just 4 star

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but not five star, dont know how they got that rating. Staff were pleasant, decor in the bar leaves alot to be desired, and the prices are abit on the high side even for five star hotel. The room decoration was good and clean, although the curtain over the bed could have done with a wash. Linen was changed as and when you wanted it. Taxis from the hotel varied in cost from 12 to 15 euros, so best to take the tram which is available just round the corner which passes all the major attractions. I would not stay at this hotel again, although had a pleasant stay, I am sure that for the cost of it you could get better value for your money elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Points to note before booking this hotel: - It is definitely not a 5 star. I have stayed at some lovely 5 star hotels and this is not even close. Maybe a 3 star. - It is out of the centre. You have to get the #5 tram for at least 10 mins to get to the centre of the Dam Square and its not in walking distance. - It is quite near the Museum area so good if you are going for that. - The double bed was actually two beds pushed together which kept moving apart. - The jaccuzi bath would have been better if it was a double sized bath. It was a bit narrow. - Toilettries were cheap - 5 star hotels don't provide cheap toilettries! - Room heating didn't work properly. - Nicest touch about the whole hotel was the free apples in the bowls on reception and in the corridors.

Reviews.Title: “not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: sammmmm
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights here and this is not a 5 star hotel,its an ok 4 star,i have stayed in better 4 stars.staff were ok,helpful but seemed a bit lost.room was clean but marked carpets and walls.i didnt mind staying here but i expected more for the money.it is a nice area if a little far out,but well served by the number 5 or 24 trams.i love amsterdam but wont be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “No Refund Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynne_Barrett
Reviews.Content: We haven't even got to the hotel yet, but the vibes aren't good. We booked a Last Minute.com City Break which flies us into Rotterdam, not Amsterdam. We found out we cannot get from the hotel to the airport for the 0710 flight as trains don't run that early (unless we book a 100 euro taxi). The hotel, given the circumstances, was not prepared to offer us a refund on the last night, which would have meant we could have booked a room in Rotterdam instead. Its policy is no refund. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Jolanda-Netherlands
Reviews.Content: A jacuzzi you can't use in the night because of the noise... (you will not use it at all because of the headaching noise) A terrible service in the restaurant... A big price paid and not even feeling welcome... A smokingroom while non-smoking was asked... Mix-up in the reservations... Bad parking... No this is not a 5 stars, 4 at highest.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: SherwoodSal
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with friendly and polite staff. It is located in a pleasant suburb, quite a long way from the city centre, but easily accessible from the Central Station by the number 24 tram (stop Apollolaan). It's also within walking distance of the Vondelpark. Two minor complaints - the bathroom door stuck and groaned a bit and the bedroom carpet was ready for a clean.
