The breakfast buffet is rather expensive at 21 euros per head but if you have plenty of time and a large appetite, you could eat enough to last you all day. If you want to skip breakfast, there are tea and coffee-making facilities in the rooms and you could go out. The bar is dear, too. In general, the hotel is quite expensive by European standards, but gave value for money as far as Amsterdam is concerned.

Reviews.Title: “RipOff Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is a ripoff. Read their website and you think it is spectacular but once you arrive it simply does not deliver. They claim they are a 5 star. It's maybe a 3 star at best. I checked in at the front desk and went to my non-smoking room only to discover the room was filled with old cigar smoke, the rug obviously worn out and dirty, the room dated, dark and dank. They advertise they have marble bathroom with jacuzzi baths. In fact, my room had a chipped porcelin midget tub with no marble in sight with the bathroom light inoperable. I immediately left the room and complained to the front desk. They said tough luck--they were going to charge my credit card because I did not preview the room before I gave my credit card at the front desk. I demanded to see the manager but he or she refused to come out of hiding. I finally told the front desk clerk that I refused to stay in a hotel that misrepresented their amenities and walked out. Upon leaving a bell boy apologized to me and said other people have experience similar problems. He was tired of covering up for management and was looking for a new job. Now I am fighting them with my credit card company and a lawyer in Amsterdam. So look out for this ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Luxury”
Reviews.Author: PatsyPie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, it was a suprise present for my husband's 40th birthday. Our rooms were great and our jaccuzi was sheer bliss. Breakfast was good, as there was an excellent choice to choose from. We did not eat evening meal in the resteraunt as we had room service each night. For that extra special touch we were provided with bath robes, slippers and toiletries. The staff were very helpful and polite. The only drawback was, that the hotel was a little further out of the town centre than we thought but I would still recommed this hotel for anyone wanting a little luxury.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just had a 2 night stay at the Bilderberg and have to say we were made very welcome and found the hotel comfortable to be in, food very good and room excellent. We would rather be in a small hotel in a quiet area and once we got our bearings to walk into town everything was easy. Many thanks to the staff who never failed to deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: mmddyy11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the bilderberg in March, 2005, and really liked it. The location is very nice, very close to trams, and out of the hustle of downtown tourist areas. We stayed in an executive room, which was very nice. Others who complain that this hotel is "not really five star" are probably correct, but for the money it was absolutley a great value (at least when I went). I think anyone who trashes this place in a review must have higher standards than I, because I really can't think of anything else this hotel could have done to make my stay better. I would observe that, in reading reviews, those who upgraded to an executive room have better impressions of the hotel than those who did not. So if you have the choice & the money, I'd say upgrade. The hotel is also close to the trams. The 5 or 24 will take you to the museum district, Leidesplein, or into Dam square. Lastly, the staff were very helpful, which I was somewhat surprised at since my wife and I were younger and not rich/fancy/upper class/etc. I expected to be ignored and/or be treated with indignant behavior, but everyone was very nice and helpful. PS - the resteraunt is rumored to be good, but is so expensive I had to skip. There are some fairly nice/upscale places just down the street (South of Appollan) which are cheaper and plenty nice.

Reviews.Title: “waste of money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: thought it would be romantic for me and my boyfriend to book a 5 star hotel but was dissapointed with this one. firstly we booked a smoking room and they gave us a non smoking room (which smelled of smoke anyway) and they wasnt able to offer us anything else. the room was nothing special and the jacuzzi is definately nothing special. mini bar was very over priced but the free fruit and "one" free coffee was ok. the staff were ok but made us feel out of place just because we were young. the menu is pretentious. id say 3 star hotel with 5 star facilities if u have a stupid amount of spare money.

HotelInfo.Name: Bilderberg Garden Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Dijsselhofplantsoen 7, Amsterdam 1077 BJ, The Netherlands
